verrucaria: <entryFree id="n50604" type="main" key="verru_ca_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verrūcārĭa herba</orth>, <sense id="n50604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant that drives away warts</hi>, helioscopium, <hi rend="ital">wartwort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turnsole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 29, § 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verrucius: <entryFree id="n50605" type="main" key="Verrucius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Verrucius</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tius</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fictitious name fraudulently used by Verres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:76:section=187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 76, § 187</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 61, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verrucosus: <entryFree id="n50606" type="main" key="verru_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verrūcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>verruca, II.</etym>, <sense id="n50606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of warts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50606.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an appellation of</hi> Q. Fabius Maximus Cunctator, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Illustr. 43" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Illustr. 43</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n50606.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rugged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verrucosa Antiopa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:77" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
verrucula: <entryFree id="n50607" type="main" key="verru_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verrūcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>verruca</etym>. <sense id="n50607.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little eminence</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 77</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50607.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small wart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verrugo: <entryFree id="n50608" type="main" key="Verrugo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Verrugo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Volsci</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Colle Ferro</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Colle Sacco</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Segni</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 58</bibl>; 5, 28; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verrunco: <entryFree id="n50609" type="main" key="verrunco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verrunco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n50609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn about;</hi> hence, in relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">to turn out well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have a fortunate issue</hi>: bene, Att. and Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 185, 24</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=373" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 373</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verrutius: <entryFree id="n50610" type="main" key="Verrutius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Verrutius</orth>, v. Verrucius.</entryFree>
versabilis: <entryFree id="n50611" type="main" key="versa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>verso</etym>, <sense id="n50611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">movable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mobile; changeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">versatile</hi> (postAug.; cf.: mutabilis, variabilis). </sense><sense id="n50611.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:16:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repagulum, of a cage,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 32</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50611.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis condicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:8:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad momentum omne,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 5, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
versabundus: <entryFree id="n50612" type="main" key="versa_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">turning round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolving</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">turbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
versatilis: <entryFree id="n50613" type="main" key="versa_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that turns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moves round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">movable</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n50613.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laquearia cenationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triclinia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 18, 29, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50613.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">versatile</hi>: ingenium, Liv 39, 40, 5.</sense></entryFree>
versatio: <entryFree id="n50614" type="main" key="versa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turning round.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50614.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">machinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 8</bibl>; 10, 10; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 14: oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 33, 51, § 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50614.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a changing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alteration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum sursum ac deorsum euntium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
versicapillus: <entryFree id="n50615" type="main" key="versi^ca^pillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versĭcăpillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>verto-capillus</etym>, <sense id="n50615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who changes hair</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">whose hair grows gray</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 48</bibl> Ritschl (al. ubi capillus versipellis flat).</sense></entryFree>
versicolor: <entryFree id="n50616" type="main" key="versi^co^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versĭcŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype> (<case>abl.</case> versicolori, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10</bibl>: <sense id="n50616.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">versicolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:7:50" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 7, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:356" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 356</bibl>; post-class. collat. form of the <hi rend="ital">nomsing.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">versĭcŏlōrus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 56</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> versicolorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:70:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 70, § 12</bibl> Momms.; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-cŏlōrĭus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:32:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 32, § 6</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>verso-color</etym>, <hi rend="ital">that changes its color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of changeable color; of various colors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partycolored</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n50616.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: plumae versicolores, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl></cit>: vestimentum, <hi rend="ital">of divers colors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">party-colored</hi>, Liv 34, 1, 3; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:70:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 70, § 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus Florae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:356" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">versĭcŏlōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">dyed stuffs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colored woolens.</hi> constabat apud veteres lanae appellatione versicoloria non contineri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:70:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 70, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:32:section=6" default="NO">34, 2, 32, § 6</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">party-colored sails</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 5, § 22</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n50616.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">translucida et versicolor quorundam elocutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, praef. § 20.</sense></entryFree>
versicolorius: <entryFree id="n50617" type="main" key="versi^co^lo_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versĭcŏlōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. versicolor <sense id="n50617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
versicolorus: <entryFree id="n50618" type="main" key="versi^co^lo_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versĭcŏlōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. versicolor, <sense id="n50618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
versiculus: <entryFree id="n50619" type="main" key="versi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>versus</etym>, <sense id="n50619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little line</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mere line</hi>: tribusne versiculis his temporibus Brutus ad me? Nihil scripsissem potius. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulae versiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: cum senatus ei commiserit, ut videret, ne quid res publica detrimenti caperet: quo uno versiculo satis armati semper consules fuerunt,<pb n="1976" /> <cb n="VERS" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 26, 70</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 6, 14</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50619.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., of poetry, <hi rend="ital">a little verse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verslet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">line</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quos (comicos poëtas), nisi quod versiculi sunt, nihil est aliud cottidiani dissimile sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:20:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne conpensabit cum uno versiculo tot mea volumina laudum suarum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:30:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 30, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:2" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 238</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
versificatio: <entryFree id="n50620" type="main" key="versi^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>versifico</etym>, <sense id="n50620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">versemaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">versifying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">versification</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quem in poëmate locum habet versificatio, eum in oratione compositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:116" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:35" default="NO">9, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
versificator: <entryFree id="n50621" type="main" key="versi^fi^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versĭfĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n50621.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a verse-maker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">versifier</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Cornelius Severus versificator quam poëta melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50621.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a poet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versificatores meliores quam duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:9:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
versifico: <entryFree id="n50622" type="main" key="versi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>versusfacio</etym>, <sense id="n50622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put into verse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">write in verse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">versify</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; not in Cic.): portenta in Homero versificata, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 533, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatiloquia Sibyllae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 46, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versificandi genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:143" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad versificandum transgressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
versificor: <entryFree id="n50623" type="main" key="versi^fi^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versĭfĭcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n50623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> collat. form of versifico, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 8, 15, 82, p. 830</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
versificus: <entryFree id="n50624" type="main" key="versi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>versifico</etym>, <sense id="n50624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">written in verse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">versified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poetic</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ordo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 11, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
versiformis: <entryFree id="n50625" type="main" key="versi^formis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versĭformis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>verto-forma</etym>, <sense id="n50625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">changing its form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changeable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">totum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupitor (Juppiter),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 589</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer (Cupido),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, § 917</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
versilis: <entryFree id="n50626" type="main" key="versi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>verto</etym>, <sense id="n50626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be turned</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">profunditas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 3, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
versiloquus: <entryFree id="n50627" type="main" key="versi^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>versus-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n50627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking in verse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> Carm. 1, 6, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
versipellis: <entryFree id="n50628" type="main" key="versi^pellis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versĭpellis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vorsĭp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vertopellis, that changes its skin; hence, in gen.</etym>, <sense id="n50628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that changes its shape</hi> or <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that alters its appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that transforms himself</hi> or <hi rend="ital">itself.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50628.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50628.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">eccum Juppiter In Amphitruonis vertit sese imaginem ... Ita versipellem se facit, quando lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus fit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>turns gray</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 48</bibl></cit> (v. s. v. versicapillus).—</sense><sense id="n50628.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ver-sĭpellis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, acc. to the superstitious belief of the ancients, <hi rend="ital">one who can change himself into a wolf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a man-wolf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">were-wolf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 22, 34, § 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 124, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50628.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">skilled in dissimulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crafty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subtle</hi> (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vorsipellem esse hominem convenit, pectus cui sapit: bonus sit bonis, malus sit malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 12</bibl></cit> Ritschl: quicum versipellis fio, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 38, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortamen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 91</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, Porc. Latro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verso: <entryFree id="n50629" type="main" key="verso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vorso</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n50629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> vorsarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 53</bibl>), <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>verto</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twist</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">whirl about often</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violently</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: verto, contorqueo). </sense><sense id="n50629.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: qui caelum versat stellis fulgentibus aptum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 30 Vahl.): Sisyphus versat Saxum, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbinem puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turdos in igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova non acri favillā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 667</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum versati appositi essent pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinclorum inmensa volumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 408</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:134" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 134</bibl></cit>; 6, 247; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 579: cardinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:221" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 221</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 22: corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortem urnā,</quote> <trans><tr>to shake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligonibus glaebas,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn up</tr>, <tr>hoe</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6, 39</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rura (juvenci),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 129: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desectum gramen,</quote> <trans><tr>hay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 646</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currum in gramine,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to wheel about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 664</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <trans><tr>to drive about</tr>, <tr>pasture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 10, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsat versatque Dareta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me versant in litore venti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 362</bibl></cit>: vos exemplaria Graeca Nocturnā versate manu, versate diurnā, <hi rend="ital">turn them over</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">read</hi>, <hi rend="ital">study them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 269</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nummulario non ex fide versanti pecunias manus amputavit,</quote> <trans><tr>handling</tr>, <tr>accounting for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 9</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, or mid., <hi rend="ital">to turn one's self often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolve</hi>, etc.: versabat se in utramque partem,<cb n="VERS" />  non solum mente, verum etiam corpore, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:30:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 30, § 74</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">satis diu jam hoc saxum vorso,</quote> <trans><tr>I have wasted time enough with this man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 55</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">mundum versari circum axem caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (orbes) versantur retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars superior mundi non versatur in turbinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suāpte naturā et cylindrum volvi et versari turbinem putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne versari aves possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50629.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50629.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versare suam naturam et regere ad tempus atque huc et illuc torquere et flectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnem malitiam et fraudem versare mentem suam coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 26, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem multis modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 40, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to treat</tr>, <tr>manage</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 9</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mille figuris variet ac verset (orator)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <trans><tr>to pervert</tr>, <tr>alter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:20:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 20, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fors omnia versat,</quote> <trans><tr>turns</tr>, <tr>changes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so mid.: versatur celeri Fors levis orbe rotae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:70" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc et illuc, Torquate, vos versetis licet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo, utrum respondebo, verses te huc atque illuc necesse est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 28, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versabat se ad omnis cogitationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50629.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. (rare in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n50629.5" n="a" level="4"> Qs. <hi rend="ital">to turn upside down</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to discompose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versabo ego illum hodie, si vivo, probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haerere homo, versari, rubere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be disturbed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:76:section=187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 76, § 187</bibl></cit>: si quid te adjuero curamve levasso Quae nunc te coquit et versat in pectore fixa, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 1, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 340 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">miserum toto cubili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum toto versant suspiria lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:22:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 22, 47</bibl></cit> (3, 16, 5): <cit><quote lang="la">odiis domos,</quote> <trans><tr>to overthrow</tr>, <tr>ruin</tr>, <tr>subvert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille placet, versatque domum, neque verbera sentit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>disturbs without being punished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic fortuna in contentione et certamine utrumque versavit, ut alter alteri inimicus auxilio salutique esset,</quote> <trans><tr>alternated with</tr>, <tr>treated each in turn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebrem animum in omnes partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrum animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora (nunc indignatio nunc pudor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 45, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spesque timorque animum versat utroque modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit> (4, 16), 12.—</sense><sense id="n50629.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To turn over</hi> a thing in the mind, <hi rend="ital">to think over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meditate</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">reflect upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider; to transact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry on</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">volvo, agito): multas res simitu in meo corde vorso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versarent in animis secum unamquamque rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 34, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa dolos dirumque nefas in pectere versat, Certa mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 563</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dolos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versate diu, quid ferre recusent, Quid valeant umeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi maxima rerum momenta versantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versenturque omni modo numeri,</quote> <trans><tr>examined</tr>, <tr>considered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:9" default="NO">10, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnia decies,</quote> <trans><tr>to interpret</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:4:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum igitur domi ante versandi sunt (testes), variis percontationibus, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>examined</tr>, <tr>practised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50629.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in the mid. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">versor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vor-sor</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, prop. to move about in a place, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to dwell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">live</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be</hi> in a place or among certain persons; constr. most freq. with <hi rend="ital">in aliquā re;</hi> also with <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apud</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">cum.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50629.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vorsari crebro hic cum viderent me domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medio pariete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ad solarium, non in campo, non in conviviis versatus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter aciem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec versari inter eos sine dedecore potero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui inter femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobiscum versari jam diutius non potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">apud praefectos regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50629.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50629.10" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to be; to be circumstanced</hi> or <hi rend="ital">situated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescis, quantis in malis vorser miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe ego te in medio versantem turbine leti Eripui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo illi nunc in pace versantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in clarissimā luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minturnenses aeternā in laude versantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in simili culpā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi ante oculos dies noctesque versaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec versantur omnino scripta eorum inter manus hominum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>are read</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of abstract subjects: numquam tibi populi Romani <cb n="VERS" /> dignitas, numquam species ipsa hujusmodi multitudinis in oculis animoque versata est? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:55:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 55, § 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors, exsilium mihi ob oculos versabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 21, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia in eodem errore versantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in dubitatione versatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 15, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mithridaticum bellum, in multā varietate versatum,</quote> <trans><tr>waged with many vicissitudes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 9, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50629.11" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to occupy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">busy one's self</hi> with any action, <hi rend="ital">to be engaged</hi> in any thing. </sense><sense id="n50629.12" n="a" level="4"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n50629.13" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">opifices omnes in sordidā arte versantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnibus ingenuis artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versabor in re difficili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:15:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re publicā atque in his vitae periculis laboribusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 12, 30</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ullā in cogitatione acrius ac diligentius versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 22, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si diutius in hoc genere verser,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 46, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum in imperiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50629.14" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">circa</hi> and <case>acc.</case> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">circa mensuras ac numeros non versabitur (orator)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50629.15" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter arma ac studia versatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50629.16" n="b" level="4"> Of abstract subjects. </sense><sense id="n50629.17" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia in eodem quo illa Zenonis errore versantur,</quote> <trans><tr>depend on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi omnis ratio in hominum more et sermone versatur,</quote> <trans><tr>is occupied with</tr>, <tr>concerns</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus omnis oratio versata est in eo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 57, 244</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imitatio est posita fere in eludendo, sed versatur etiam in factis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: ipsae res in perfacili cognitione versantur <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:35:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 35, 122</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">quae omnes artes in veri investigatione versantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae in causā versarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epilogi omnes in eādem fere materiā versari solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:1" default="NO">2, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praejudiciorum vis omnis tribus in generibus versatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50629.18" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">circa</hi> and <case>acc.</case> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec pars (tragoedia) circa iram, odium, metum, miserationem fere tota versatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa quae versari videatur omnis quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam circa res omnes, quidam circa civiles modo versari rhetoricen putaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50629.19" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque (finitio) pluribus legibus isdem quibus conjectura versatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit> (dub.; Halm, ex conj. in isdem).—</sense><sense id="n50629.20" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo in aliis causis exercitatus et in hac multum et saepe versatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri in rerum publicarum varietate versati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper inter arma ac studia versatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">is missum ad dilectus agendos Agricolam integreque ac strenue versatum praeposuit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
versor: <entryFree id="n50630" type="main" key="versor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. verso, II.</entryFree>
versoria: <entryFree id="n50631" type="main" key="verso_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versōrĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vors-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>verto</etym>, <sense id="n50631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rope that guides a sail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sheet</hi> (Plautin.); hence, trop.: versoriam capere, <hi rend="ital">to turn the sail</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">tack</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cape vorsoriam, Recipe te ad erum,</quote> <trans><tr>about ship!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cape modo vorsoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
versum: <entryFree id="n50632" type="main" key="versum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vors-</orth>), v. 2. versus.</entryFree>
versura: <entryFree id="n50633" type="main" key="versu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vors-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>verto</etym>, <sense id="n50633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turning round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twirling about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rotating.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50633.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">foliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:46" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus loci (coxendicum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 7, § 67</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n50633.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50633.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The turning-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn</hi> at the end of a furrow, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50633.4" n="B" level="2"> In archit., <hi rend="ital">a turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">angle</hi> of a wall, Vitr 3, 1; 5, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 5, 12; <cit><quote lang="la">or in a water conduit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50633.5" n="C" level="2"> (Qs. a changing of one's creditor.) <hi rend="ital">The borrowing of money to pay a debt</hi> (the class. signif. of the word); and hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a borrowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versuram facere mutuam pecuniam sumere ex eo dictum est, quod initio qui mutuabantur ab aliis, non ut domum ferrent, sed ut aliis solverent, velut verterent creditorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=379" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 379</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">eos homines versuram a Carpinatio fecisse, qui pecunias Verri dedissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:76:section=186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 76, § 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine mutuatione et sine versurā dissolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Salaminii cum Romae versuram facere vellent, non poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 20, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum versuram facere publice necesse esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 5</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 19:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 19, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:8:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 5, 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor, ne illud, quod tecum permutavi, versurā mihi solvendum sit,</quote> <trans><tr>is to be paid by a new loan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versurā factā solvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: non modo versurā, verum etiam<pb n="1977" /> <cb n="VERT" />  venditione, si ita res coget, nos vindicabis, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versura vetita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: in eodem luto haesitas, vorsurā solves, <hi rend="ital">you pay by borrowing</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">you get out of one difficulty by getting into another</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
versus: <entryFree id="n50634" type="main" key="versus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vors-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of verto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50635" type="main" key="versus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vors-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos>, v. verto, <sense id="n50635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50636" type="main" key="versus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vors-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype> (ante-class. collat. form of the <number>plur.</number> versi, Laev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 712</bibl> P.: versorum, Laber. ib.: versis, Val. ib.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>verto, a turning round, i. e. of the plough</etym>. <sense id="n50636.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A furrow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 177</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50636.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a line</hi>, <hi rend="ital">row.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50636.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in versum distulit ulmos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 30, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 37, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creber catenarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:658" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 658</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50636.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a line</hi> of writing; and in poetry, <hi rend="ital">a verse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut primum versum (legis) attenderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deplorat primis versibus mansionem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 261</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum numerum versuum ediscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 24, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:37" default="NO">7, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:38" default="NO">10, 1, 38</bibl>; 10, 1, 41; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 11, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis minorem gloriae fructum putat ex Graecis versibus percipi quam ex Latinis, vehementer errat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 257</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 50, 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:20:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 20, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:48 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 48 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:39" default="NO">11, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:51" default="NO">11, 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50636.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The note</hi>, <hi rend="ital">song</hi> of the nightingale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50636.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A land-measure</hi>, = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ple/qron</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:10:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 10, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50636.6" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of dance</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">a turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">step</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pas</hi> in a dance, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
versute: <entryFree id="n50637" type="main" key="versu_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versūtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. versutus <sense id="n50637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
versutia: <entryFree id="n50638" type="main" key="versu_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versūtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>versutus</etym>, <sense id="n50638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slyness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">craftiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subtlety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingenuity</hi> (very rare; cf.: dolus, astutia); <number>sing.</number> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 307, 41</bibl>; p. 325, 25.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:47:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 47, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
versutiloquus: <entryFree id="n50639" type="main" key="versu_ti^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versūtĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>versutusloquor</etym>, <sense id="n50639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crafly-speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sly</hi>: malitiae, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 154</bibl>, and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 49, 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
versutus: <entryFree id="n50640" type="main" key="versu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">versūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vors-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>a lengthened form of versus, from verto; cf. astutus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>. <sense id="n50640.0" n="I" level="1"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">adroit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dexterous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">versatile; shrewd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingenious</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. callidus): homo versutus et callidus (versutos eos appello, quorum celeriter mens versatur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (genus acuminis) erat in reprehendendis verbis versutum et sollers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:236" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 67, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus acutus atque versutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:20:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 20, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versutissimum et patientissimum Lacedaemonium Lysandrum accepimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens docte vorsutus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50640.1" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crafty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi> (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. vafer): vorsutior es quam rota figularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non esse servus pejor hoc quisquam potest, Nec magis versutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 106</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc est hominis versuti, obscuri, astuti, fallacis, malitiosi, callidi, veteratoris, vafri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 13, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acutus, versutus, veterator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corinna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:312 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 312 al.</bibl></cit>— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:118:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 118, 1</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versutus ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 56</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ver-sūtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">cunningly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">craftily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slyly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9, 35</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, Aug Trin. 15, 20.</sense></entryFree>
vertacomacori: <entryFree id="n50641" type="main" key="Vertacomacori"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vertacomacori</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tribe of the Vocontii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vertagus: <entryFree id="n50642" type="foreign" key="verta^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vertăgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Celtic</etym>, <sense id="n50642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a greyhound</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:200:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 200, 1</bibl>; Firm. Math. 5, 8.— Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">vertăga</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">vertăgra</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">vertrăga</orth>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 203</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vertebra: <entryFree id="n50643" type="main" key="verte_^bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vertē^bra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>verto</etym>, <sense id="n50643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joint.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50643.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 46, 106, § 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78, 8</bibl>.—Of insects, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 1, 1, § 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50643.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a joint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vertebra</hi> of the spine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50643.3" n="III" level="1"> In late Lat. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">vertē^brum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)sxi/on</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the hip-bone</hi>, Cael. Aur Acut. 1, 10, 71 al.</sense></entryFree>
vertebratus: <entryFree id="n50644" type="main" key="vertebra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vertebrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vertebra</etym>, <sense id="n50644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">jointed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">articulated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vertebrated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 67, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vertex: <entryFree id="n50645" type="main" key="vertex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vertex</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">vortex</orth>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 25</bibl> The archaic form vortex was already disused in Cicero's time; cf. Ribbeck, Prol. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> 436 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 481</bibl> n. Wagn. The grammarian <cb n="VERT" /> Caper distinguishes thus: vortex fluminis est, vertex capitis; but this distinction was unknown in the class. per.; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 68</bibl>), <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>verto</etym>. <sense id="n50645.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A whirl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eddy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whirlpool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vortex</hi>: secundo modo dicitur proprium inter plura, quae sunt ejusdem nominis, id, unde cetera ducta sunt: ut vertex est contorta in se aqua vel quicquid aliud similiter vertitur: inde propter flexum capillorum pars summa capitis; <cit><quote lang="la">ex hoc id, quod in montibus eminentissimum. Recte dixeris haec omnia vertices, proprie tamen, unde initium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aquae circumlatae in se sorbeantur et vorticem efficiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torto vertice torrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 567</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam ... rapidus vorat aequore vertex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(flumen) minores volvere vertices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 587</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 556</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:502" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 502</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:230" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 230</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">citatior solito amnis transverso vertice dolia inpulit ad ripam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 19, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 30, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:13:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 13, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50645.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā medius pugnae vocat agmina vertex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:230" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 230</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50645.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An eddy of wind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a whirlwind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coil of flame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(venti) interdum vertice torto Corripiunt rapideque rotanti turbine portant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 293</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:444" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 444</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 58, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extemplo cadit igneus ille Vertex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 298</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 673</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus saepius in se volutatur, similemque illis, quas diximus converti aquas, facit vorticem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 13, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50645.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The top</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crown</hi> of the head. </sense><sense id="n50645.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab imis unguibus usque ad verticem summum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 48, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 288</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 712</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:8:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:10" default="NO">1, 11, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50645.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50645.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The head</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:310" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 310</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto vertice supra est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:784" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 784</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moribundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intonsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:607" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 607</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:307" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 307</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50645.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The pole</hi> of the heavens, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 41, 105; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:Rep. 6:20:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 242</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50645.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The highest point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summit</hi> of a mountain, house, tree, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes, qui ex Aetnae vertice erumpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 467</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1</bibl>. 316; 13, 911; Petr. poët. 122; 134 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:3:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 3, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Erycino vertice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 759</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:700" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 700</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 750</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:36:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 36, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:19:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 19, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 103</bibl></cit>.—Hence, a vertice, <hi rend="ital">from above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">down from above</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 310</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 444</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50645.9" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the highest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uttermost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greatest</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">dolorum anxiferi vertices, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 21: principiorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the highest officers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandria enim vertex omnium est civitatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 16, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vertibulum: <entryFree id="n50646" type="hapax" key="verti^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vertĭbŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joint</hi>, for the usual vertebra, lact. Opif. Dei, 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
verticillus: <entryFree id="n50647" type="main" key="verti^cillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vertĭcillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the whirl</hi> of a spindle, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verticordia: <entryFree id="n50648" type="main" key="Verti^cordi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vertĭcordĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>verto-cor</etym>, <sense id="n50648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Turner of hearts</hi>, an epithet of Venus, who was supposed to restrain maidens from unchastity, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:15:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 15, 12</bibl>; Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Obseq.</author> 97</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:157 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 157 sq.</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
verticosus: <entryFree id="n50649" type="main" key="verti^co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vertĭcōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vort-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vertex, I.</etym>, <sense id="n50649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of whirlpools</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eddies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eddying</hi>: mare, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 121</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 22</bibl> Dietsch); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:8:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
verticula: <entryFree id="n50650" type="main" key="verti^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vertĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>verto</etym>, <sense id="n50650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joint</hi>, = vertebra, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 207, 24</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=371" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 371</bibl>.—In machines, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13, 1</bibl>.— Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">vertĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:242" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 242</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">vertĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 138</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
