vertigino: <entryFree id="n50651" type="hapax" key="verti_gi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vertīgĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>vertigo</etym>, <sense id="n50651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to whirl round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puncta luminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vertiginosus: <entryFree id="n50652" type="hapax" key="verti_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vertīgĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who suffers from giddiness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vertigo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vertiginous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 2, 28, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vertigo: <entryFree id="n50653" type="main" key="verti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vertīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>verto</etym>, <sense id="n50653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">whirling round</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n50653.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">assidua caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:548" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 548</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:13:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torti fili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduā vertigine rotare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 150</bibl></cit>: quibus una Quiritem Vertigo facit, <hi rend="ital">a turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twirl</hi> of a slave in manumission, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:76" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50653.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a whirling</hi> <cb n="VERT" /> <hi rend="ital">of the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">giddiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dizziness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vertigo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 15, 57, § 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:194" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 17, 73, § 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:117" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 9, 70, § 117</bibl>; 25, 11, 89, § 139 al.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 9</bibl>.—Of persons intoxicated, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:304" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 304</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50653.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a revolution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alteration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertigine rerum Attoniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
verto: <entryFree id="n50654" type="main" key="verto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vorto</orth>), <itype>ti, sum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n50654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> vortier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 710</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:927" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 927</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1199 al" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1199 al.</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root vart-, to apply one's self, turn; cf. vart-ukas, round</etym>. </sense><sense id="n50654.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn round</hi> or <hi rend="ital">about</hi> (syn.: verso, contorqueo). </sense><sense id="n50654.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(luna) eam partem, quaecumque est ignibus aucta, Ad speciem vertit nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 724</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciem quo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora huc et huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:9" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:5:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradu discedere verso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verso pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:869" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 869</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to fly away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:24:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 24, 22</bibl></cit> (3, 19, 6): <cit><quote lang="la">cardinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:782" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 782</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores tacito cardine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: cadum, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tip up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versā pulvis inscribitur hastā,</quote> <trans><tr>inverted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verte hac te, puere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verti me a Minturnis Arpinum versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum haesisset descendenti (virgini) stola, vertit se et recollegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante tuos quotiens verti me, perfida, postes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:43" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeiani se verterunt et loco cesserunt,</quote> <trans><tr>turned about</tr>, <tr>wheeled about</tr>, <tr>fled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vertere terga,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn one's back</tr>, <tr>run away</tr>, <tr>betake one's self to flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 63</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14, 9</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: hostem in fugam,</quote> <trans><tr>to put to flight</tr>, <tr>rout</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:33:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 33, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 17: iter retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems (piscis) ad hoc mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:52" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 52</bibl></cit>: fenestrae in viam versae, <hi rend="ital">turned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">directed towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">looking towards</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 41, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mare ad occidentem versum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scytharum gens ab oriente ad septentrionem se vertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Maeander) nunc ad fontes, nunc in mare versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 165</bibl></cit>: terram aratro, <hi rend="ital">to turn up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plough</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebas (aratra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 425</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 477</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum bidentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros bove,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7:43" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7, 43</bibl></cit> (4, 6, 43): <cit><quote lang="la">collem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">freta lacertis (in rowing),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex illā pecuniā magnam partem ad se vortit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:17:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17, 57</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: vertier ad lapidem, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incline one's self towards</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1199</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">congressi ... ad caedem vertuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">versi in fugam hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippis versa acies retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinit hic violentis omnia verti Turbinibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to whirl themselves about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus caeli si vortitur orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertitur interea caelum,</quote> <trans><tr>revolves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">squamarum serie a caudā ad caput versā,</quote> <trans><tr>reaching</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 30, § 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50654.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50654.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ea, quae reipublicae causa egerit, in suam contumeliam vertat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suam rem litem vertendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:72:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 72, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usum ejus (olei) ad luxuriam vertere Graeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 4, 5, § 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in rem vertere,</quote> <trans><tr>turn to account</tr>, <tr>make profitable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 3, 1</bibl></cit> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">edocere, quo sese vertant sortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:v. 64" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. v. 64</bibl></cit> Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 671</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sibi vitio verterent, quod abesset a patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idque omen in Macedonum metum verterunt Tyrii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in religionem vertentes comitia biennic habita,</quote> <trans><tr>making a matter of religious scruple</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum insolita magnitudo in religionem versa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 38, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ipsum quod iter belli esset obstructum, in prodigium et omen imminentium cladium vertebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 86 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertere in se Cotyi data,</quote> <trans><tr>to appropriate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perii! quid agam? quo me vertam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo se verteret, non habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 72, 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippus totus in Persea versus,</quote> <trans><tr>inclined towards him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toti in impetum atque iram versi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 16, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bellum omne eo vertat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di vortant bene, Quod agas,</quote> <trans><tr>cause to turn out well</tr>, <tr>prosper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 121</bibl></cit>; cf. infra, II. B.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in melius somnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:95" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50654.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50654.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To turn</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transform</hi> (syn. muto): <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter In Amphitruonis vortit sese imaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in anginam ego nunc me velim vorti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1</bibl></cit>. 3, 61: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes natura cibos in corpora viva Vertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:880" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 880</bibl></cit>: vertunt se fluvii frondes et pabula laeta In pecudes; vertunt pecudes <pb n="1978" /> <cb n="VERT" /> in corpora nostra Naturam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:875 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 875 sq.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum terra in aquam se vertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verte omnis tete in facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:891" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 891</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego, quae memet in omnia verti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot sese vertit in ora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque deum de bove versus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:616" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auster in Africum se vertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 24, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina malorum in contrarias partes se vertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia versa et mutata in pejorem partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:36:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 36, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur nunc tua quisquam Vertere jussa potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic continentiam et moderationem in superbiam ac lasciviam vertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna hoc militiae probrum vertit in gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus civitatis status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versis ad prospera fatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 89</bibl></cit>: solum, <hi rend="ital">to change one's country</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to emigrate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go into exile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 3, 11</bibl> et saep.; v. solum. —With <case>abl.</case> (rare and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nullā tamen alite verti Dignatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 157</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">muto.—Prov.: in fumum et cinerem vertere,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn into smoke</tr>, <tr>dissipate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 39</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia vertuntur: certe vertuntur amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit> (9): <cit><quote lang="la">saevus apertam In rabiem coepit verti jocus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 149</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50654.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To exchange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interchange</hi>: nos divitem istum meminimus adque iste pauperes nos; <cit><quote lang="la">vorterunt sese memoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vorsis gladiis depugnarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50654.8" n="c" level="4"> Of literary productions, <hi rend="ital">to turn into another language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to translate</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">transfero, interpretor, reddo): Philemo scripsit, Plautus vortit barbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. prol. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sic verterem Platonem, ut verteruntnostri poëtae fabulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verti etiam multa de Graecis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annales Acilianos ex Graeco in Latinum sermonem vertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 39, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50654.9" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To ply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulos sub pectore vertit Apollo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>stimulates the fury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 101</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50654.10" n="e" level="4"> In partic., like our to turn upside down, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to overturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subvert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> (= everto): <cit><quote lang="la">Callicratidas cum multa fecisset egregie, vertit ad extremum omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agerent, verterent cuncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cycnum Vi multā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluxas Phrygiae res fundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 652</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertere ab imo moenia Trojae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 810</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ilion fatalis incestusque judex ... vertit in pulverem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proceras fraxinos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 25, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab imo regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 562" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Troad. 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 650</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50654.11" n="f" level="4"> Mid., from the idea of turning round in a place, <hi rend="ital">to be engaged in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in</hi> a place or condition; also <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rest</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">depend upon</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">jam homo in mercaturā vortitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res in periculo vortitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 8, 19</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">res vertitur in majore discrimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 36, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse catervis Vertitur in mediis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 683</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia in unius potestate ac moderatione vertentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">spes civitatis in dictatore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum id in voluntate Philippi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa in jure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:39:145" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 39, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum circa hanc consultationem disceptatio omnis verteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puncto saepe temporis maximarum rerum momenta verti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 27, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertebatur, utrum manerent in Achaico concilio Lacedaemonii, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 48, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50654.12" n="g" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To ascribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae fuerunt populis magis exitio quam fames morbique, quaeque alia in deum iras velut ultima malorum vertunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 9, 3</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnium secundorum adversorumque in deos verterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50654.13" n="h" level="4"> = considero; exercitum majorum more vortere, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 5, 408</bibl> dub. (Sall. H. inc. 51 Dietsch ad loc.).</sense><sense id="n50654.14" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direct one's way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50654.15" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">depulsi aemulatione alio vertunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eoque audaciae provectum ut verteret, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam mea vocula dominae vertat in auriculas!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versuros extemplo in fugam omnes ratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 26, 8</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 617</bibl> the correct read. is cancri se ut vortat).—</sense><sense id="n50654.16" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam verterat fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 49, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem aliorum in suam vertisse servitutem conquerebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totae solidam in glaciem vertere lacunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 365</bibl></cit>: verterat pernicies in accusatorem, <cb n="VERU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si esset factum, detrimentum in bonum verteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 73 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea ludificatio veri in verum vertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: talia incepta, ni in consultorem vertissent, reipublicae pestem factura, <hi rend="ital">against</hi>, Sall. H. inc. 89 Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">neque inmerito suum ipsorum exemplum in eos versurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 38, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si malus est, male res vortunt, quas agit,</quote> <trans><tr>turn out badly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quae res tibi vertat male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bene vertat, castra Albanos Romanis castris jungere jubet (= cum bonis omnibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62:5" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 62, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 35, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bene verteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:14" default="NO">7, 11, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos illi (quod nec vertat bene), mittimus haedos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50654.17" n="b" level="4"> Annus, mensis vertens, <hi rend="ital">the course</hi> or <hi rend="ital">space of a year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of a month</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno vertente sine controversiā (petisses),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 12, 40</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">anno vertente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 4, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">apparuisse numen deorum intra finem anni vertentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu si hanc emeris, Numquam hercle hunc mensem vortentem, credo, servibit tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50654.18" n="(b)" level="5"> Pregn.: annus vertens, <hi rend="ital">the great year</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cycle</hi> of the celestial bodies (a space of 15,000 solar years), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 22, 24</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ver-sus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vors-</orth>), <itype>or</itype> (much less freq.) <orth extent="full" lang="la">ver-sum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vors-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">turned in the direction of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">towards</hi> a thing; usu. after the name of a place to which motion is directed (orig. a <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turned towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">facing</hi>, etc., and so always in Livy; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18, 6</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; 1, 41, 4; 9, 2, 15). </sense><sense id="n50654.19" n="A" level="2"> Form versus (vors-). </sense><sense id="n50654.20" n="1" level="3"> After <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Labienum ad Oceanum versus ... proficisci jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 33</bibl></cit>: ad Alpes versus, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Cercinam insulam versus, Auct. B. Afr. 8, 3: ad Cordubam versus, Auct. B. Hisp. 11: modo ad Urbem, modo in Galliam versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 56:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 56, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50654.21" n="2" level="3"> After <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agrum versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in forum versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Arvernos versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 8</bibl></cit>: si in urbem versus venturi erunt, Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 78</bibl> (82), 3.—</sense><sense id="n50654.22" n="3" level="3"> After <case>acc.</case> alone (class. only with names of towns and small islands): <cit><quote lang="la">verti me a Minturnis Arpinum versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brundisium versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ambraciam versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massiliam versus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Narbonem versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50654.23" n="4" level="3"> After other <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorsum versus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sursum versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 39, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimittit quoquo versus legationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quaedam vocabula utroque versus dicantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. the adverbs deorsum, sursum, etc.—</sense><sense id="n50654.24" n="B" level="2"> Form versum (vors-). </sense><sense id="n50654.25" n="1" level="3"> After <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animadvertit fugam ad se versum fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 58, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50654.26" n="2" level="3"> After other <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunas rursum vorsum trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 60</bibl></cit> (63): <cit><quote lang="la">lumbis deorsum versum pressis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineam sursum vorsum semper ducito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum undique versum circumfluat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:13:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utroque vorsum rectum est ingenium meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.!*? Versus is said by many lexicons to be also a <pos>prep.</pos>, but no ancient authority can be safely cited for this use. The true readings are: <cit><quote lang="la">in Italiam versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus aedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 20, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in forum versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 43, 60, § 121</bibl></cit>; and perh. in oppidum, Auct. B. Hisp. 21.</sense></entryFree>
vertraga: <entryFree id="n50655" type="main" key="vertraga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vertraga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v vertagus.</entryFree>
vertumnus: <entryFree id="n50656" type="main" key="Vertumnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vertumnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Vort-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>qs. vertomenos, as a <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>, from verto, that turns or changes himself</etym>, orig. an Etruscan deity, <sense id="n50656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god of the changing year</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the seasons and their productions</hi>, also <hi rend="ital">of exchange and of trade</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=46" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 46</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 2, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:410" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 410</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:642 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 642 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:59:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 59, § 154</bibl> Ascon. Near his statue in the forum at Rome were the booksellers' shops, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also the market-gardeners, Col. poët. 10, 308.—As a symbol of mutability: Vertumnis natus iniquis, said of an unstable man,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vertum-nālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of Vertumnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 21</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
veru: <entryFree id="n50657" type="main" key="ve^ru"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕru</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (collat. form of the <sense id="n50657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 15</bibl> and 17; <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> collat. form of the <number>plur.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrōnes</orth> <itype>plumbei</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 17" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 17</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> verubus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 646</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:82 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 82 al.</bibl>: veribus, Charis. pp. 50 and 112; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 672</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 396</bibl>; id. A. <cb n="VERU" /> 1, 212; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:88 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 10, 27, § 88 al.</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. for sveru; Sanscr. svarn, a stake</etym>. </sense><sense id="n50657.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A spit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broach</hi>, esp. for roasting upon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=127" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 127</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 212</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 396</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 646</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:363" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 363</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 10, 27, § 88</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50657.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A dart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">javelin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 665</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 413</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50657.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a paling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">railing</hi> round an altar or a tomb, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 736</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50657.4" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A critical sign on the margin of a book</hi>, = obelus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 106, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veruculatus: <entryFree id="n50658" type="hapax" key="ve^ru_cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrūcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>veruculum</etym>, <sense id="n50658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with a small pike</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">falces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veruculum: <entryFree id="n50659" type="main" key="ve^ru_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrūcŭlum</orth>, v. vericulum.</entryFree>
verudoctius: <entryFree id="n50660" type="main" key="Verudocti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Verudoctĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief of the Helvetii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sent as an ambassador to Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veruina: <entryFree id="n50661" type="main" key="ve^ru^i_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrŭīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>veru</etym>, <sense id="n50661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small javelin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 46</bibl>; Gavius Bassus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> 564, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verulae: <entryFree id="n50662" type="main" key="Veru^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Verŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of</hi> Latium, now <hi rend="ital">Veroli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:11:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 11, 6</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Verŭ-lānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Verulœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 43</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Verŭlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Verulœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verum: <entryFree id="n50663" type="main" key="ve^rum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. veru <sense id="n50663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n50664" type="main" key="ve_rum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. verus, I. B. and II. A. 3.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50665" type="main" key="ve_rum3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. verus <sense id="n50665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
verumtamen: <entryFree id="n50666" type="main" key="ve_rumta^men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērum-tămen</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">vērun-tămen</orth>; in recent edd. more freq. as two words, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vē-rum tămen</orth>; <sense id="n50666.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">sometimes separated,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:41:section=101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 41, § 101</bibl> infra), <hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [verum-tamen], <hi rend="ital">but yet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notwithstanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nevertheless</hi> (class.): cum pugnabant maxume, ego fugiebam maxime; <cit><quote lang="la">verum quasi adfuerim tamen simulabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium capit primo stultum, verum tamen clemens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:39:section=101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 39, § 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 30, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malā defensione, verum aliquā tamen uti videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:41:section=101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 41, § 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 26</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animadvertebas igitur, etsi tum nemo erat admodum copiosus, verum tamen versus ab his admisceri orationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum manifesta sibi est ... verum tamen aestuat intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 465</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes, in resuming the thread of discourse, after a parenthetical clause: <cit><quote lang="la">cum essem in Tusculano (erit hoc tibi pro illo tuo cum essem in Ceramico), verum tamen cum ibi essem, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>but as I was saying</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 2, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verus: <entryFree id="n50667" type="main" key="ve_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Zend var, believe; Sanscr. var, choose, wish</etym>, <sense id="n50667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">true</hi>, <hi rend="ital">real</hi>, <hi rend="ital">actual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genuine</hi>, etc. (opp. falsus, fictus). </sense><sense id="n50667.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">secerni blandus amicus a vero et internosci tam potest adhibitā diligentiā, quam omnia fucata et simulata a sinceris atque veris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicere, quid in quāque re verum sincerumque sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera an falsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res vera (opp. ficta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verus ac germanus Metellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 147</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsus verus Harpax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera mea uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 46</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">al. verum): color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera et perfecta amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera, gravis, solida gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:23:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 23, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa verissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nati,</quote> <trans><tr>legitimate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verius ergo quid sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:76:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 76, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut verum esset, suā voluntate sapientem descendere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id si ita est, ut, etc.... sin autem illa veriora, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50667.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vērum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">what is true</hi> or <hi rend="ital">real</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the reality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fact</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interesse oportet, ut inter rectum et pravum, sic inter verum et falsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notionem veri et falsi nullam habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si simile veri quid invenerim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si verum scire vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si verum quaerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum quidem si audire volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:73:256" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 73, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum non libenter audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:76:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 76, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor est tua gloria vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15</bibl></cit> (16), 143: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quid hujus veri sit, sciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 72</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non pervident quid sit in vero,</quote> <trans><tr>actually</tr>, <tr>really</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.—So the freq. construction of the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> veri with similis, similiter, and similitudo (by many also joined together<pb n="1979" /> <cb n="VERU" />  in one word, verisimilis, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">narrationem jubent veri similem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod veri simile occurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri simillimum mihi videtur, quodam tempore, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri similiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:24:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 24, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res similis veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 38, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simillimum veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est magis verisimile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri similiter fingere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri similius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> and p. 312; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri similitudinem sequi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:33:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 33, 2</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">genuine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 17, § 66</bibl>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, in a reversed order: similitudo veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:11:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 11, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res facit controversiam aut de vero aut de recto aut de nomine,</quote> <trans><tr>respecting fact</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 34, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec procul a vero est, quod,</quote> <trans><tr>from the truth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex vero positum permansit Equiria nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:859" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 859</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vero esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be true</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneras aures mordaci radere vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:107" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 107</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recta et vera loquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 239</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 55 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem se tradere vera ac falsa dijudicandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui species alias veris ... caput (= alias ab iis quae verae sunt, Orell.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjecta veris credibilis rerum imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:123" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis dicam tibi veriora veris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:30:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 30, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n50667.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50667.4" n="A" level="2"> Like rectus, consonant with reason or good morals, i. e. <hi rend="ital">right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reasonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ah, Idnest verum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquid verum ac rectum esse dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est rectum, verum quoque est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia recta, vera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:27:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 27, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex vera atque princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus peritia et verum ingenium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 111</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, si vera existimare voles, maxume hortabuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 4:61:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 61, 3</bibl></cit> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">nil Grosphus nisi verum orabit et aequum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50667.5" n="2" level="3"> Esp., verum est, with <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi> (so most freq. = aequum est, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">neque verum esso, qui suos fines tueri non potuerint, alienos occupare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cato) negat verum esse, allici benevolentiam cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum est, (agrum) habere eos, quorum sanguine ac sudore partus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 48, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 40, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48:11" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 48, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">28, 13, 7: metiri se quemque suo modulo ac pede, verum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 212</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verius esse, Ti. Sempronio imperium habenti tradi exercitum quam legato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me verius unum Pro vobis foedus luere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 694</bibl></cit>: si verum est, with <hi rend="ital">acc. and inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if the view is correct</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 26, 7</bibl>.— Rarely with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclarum illud est, et, si quaeris, rectum quoque et verum, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>right and just</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:29:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 29, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si verum est, quod nemo dubitat, ut populus Romanus superarit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50667.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vērum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in senatu parsilla, quae vero pretium aut gratiam anteferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50667.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Speaking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">containing the truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">true</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veracious</hi>, = veridicus (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sum verus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinis os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium viri eruditissimi ac super ista verissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 25, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 9, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo viro nihil firmius, nihil verius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 4:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verissimus et sapientissimus judex,</quote> <trans><tr>most conscientious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 84</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50667.8" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vērum</orth>. </sense><sense id="n50667.9" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">truly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubtless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yes</hi>, as a confirmatory reply (ante-class. and rare, while vero is classical; v. vero <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Facies? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Verum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 2, 45</bibl>. <hi rend="ital">Ct.</hi> Men' quaerit? <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Verum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 6, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50667.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50667.11" n="a" level="4"> In gen., as a strongly corroborative adversative particle, <hi rend="ital">but in truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but not with standing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but yet;</hi> and after negative clauses, <hi rend="ital">but even</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">merito maledicas mihi, si id ita factum est: Verum haud mentior, resque uti facta, dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in optimorum consiliis posita est civitatium salus: praesertim cum, etc.... Verum hunc optimum statum pravis hominum opinionibus eversum esse dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ejus (Hermagorae) peccatum reprehendendum videtur, verum brevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:9:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae non dicunt, verum intellegi volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed nos non, quid nobis utile, verum quid oratori necessarium sit, quaerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 254</bibl></cit>: ea sunt <cb n="VERU" /> omnia non a naturā, verum a magistro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 29, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50667.12" n="(b)" level="5"> In the construction non modo (solum, tantum) ... verum etiam (quoque), <hi rend="ital">not only</hi> ... <hi rend="ital">but also</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo agendo, verum etiam cogitando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 19, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:66:section=161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 66, § 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum naturā et moribus, verum etiam studio et doctrinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ingrato tantum, verum etiam invido et crudeli animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:6:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servavit ab omni Non solum facto, verum opprobrio quoque turpi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 84</bibl></cit>: non modo ... verum ne ... quidem, <hi rend="ital">not only not</hi> ... <hi rend="ital">but not even</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:30:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 30, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50667.13" n="b" level="4"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50667.14" n="(a)" level="5"> In a transition, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non edepol nunc, ubi terrarum sim scio, si quis roget ... Ilicet, mandata eri perierunt una et Sosia, Verum certum'st confidenter hominem contra adloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde hoc vobis confirmo, etc.... verum quod ego laboribus, etc.... me persecuturum esse polliceor, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:17:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 17, 51</bibl></cit>: verum schemata <foreign lang="greek">le/cews</foreign> duorum sunt generum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum etiamsi quis summa desperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum veniat sane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:31:section=76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 31, § 76</bibl></cit> et saep.—Strengthened by enim, vero, and (in class. prose) enimvero, <hi rend="ital">but truly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but indeed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum enim, quando bene promeruit, fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: verum vero inter offam atque herbam, ibi vero longum intervallum est, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:17:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum hercle vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ullo in loco ejus provinciae frumentum tanti fuit, quanti, etc. Verum enim vero cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:84:section=194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 84, § 194</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">verum enim vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 54</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50667.15" n="(b)" level="5"> In breaking off the current of discourse (cf. sed), <hi rend="ital">but however</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectabantur Calendae Januariae, fortasse non recte. Verum praeterita omittamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: verum quidem haec hactenus; <cit><quote lang="la">cetera quotiescumque voletis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:34:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 34, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed hoc nihil ad me ... Verum hoc (ut dixi) nihil ad me. Illud ad me, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:32:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 32, 139</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50667.16" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vērō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in fact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be sure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuredly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eho, mavis vituperari falso, quam vero extolli?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste eum sese ait, qui non est, esse: et qui vero est negat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Tox.</hi> Amplectere sis. <hi rend="ital">Lemn.</hi> Ego vero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 5</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">As.</hi> Ego non novi adulescentem vostrum. <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Veron'? <hi rend="ital">As.</hi> Serio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veron' serio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itane vero obturbat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Vah, gloriare evenisse ex sententiā? <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Non hercle vero, verum dico, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod de domo scribis ... ego vero tum denique mihi videbor restitutus, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">even at the beginning of a letter: ego vero cupio te ad me venire,</quote> <trans><tr>I do really wish</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 16, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ego vero vellem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum effusis gaudio lacrimis cupere vero diceret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 19, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 20, 1</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp., in apodosis, tum vero: postea quam ad causam dicendam ventum est, tum vero sine metu omnes erant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:29:section=70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 29, § 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:412" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 412</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tum, III. B. 1.—Ironically: sane quia vero hae mihi patent semper fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum vero haec eis jura profuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:47:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 47, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpem vero actionem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregiam vero laudem refertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 93</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">immo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo vero indignum facinus faxo ex me audies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 13</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50667.17" n="b" level="4"> In corroborative replies, <hi rend="ital">yes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by all means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuredly</hi>, etc. (class.; while verum in this sense is only ante-class.): <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> An quid est etiam amplius? <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Vero amplius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 12</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">M.</hi> Fuisti saepe, credo, in scholis philosophorum. <hi rend="ital">A.</hi> Vero, ac libenter quidem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 11, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tu orationes nobis veteres explicabis?
