Vero, inquam, Brute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:87:300" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 87, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu vero, inquam, Tite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 85, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos vero, inquit ille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:28:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 28, 80</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">M.</hi> Cadere, opinor, in sapientem aegritudinem tibi dixisti videri. <hi rend="ital">A.</hi> Et vero ita existimo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 12</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">immo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nay rather: De.</hi> Quin tu mi argentum cedo. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Immo vero uxorem tu cedo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed da mihi nunc, satisne probas? Immo vero et haec, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo vero, inquit, ii vivunt, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:14:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">S.</hi> Quid domi? pluresne praesunt negotiis tuis? <hi rend="ital">L.</hi> Immo vero unus, <cb n="VESA" /> inquit, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 39, 61</bibl>.—And, to strengthen negative answers, joined with <hi rend="ital">minime: S.</hi> Quid? totam domum num quis alter, praeter te, regit? <hi rend="ital">L.</hi> Minime vero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:39:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 39, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 32, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:29 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 6, 29 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50667.18" n="c" level="4"> In urgent or encouraging expostulation, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">though</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however</hi>, etc.: <hi rend="ital">Ni.</hi> Cape hoc tibi aurum, Chrysale, i, fer filio. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Non equidem accipiam. <hi rend="ital">Ni.</hi> Cape vero: <cit><quote lang="la">odiose facis,</quote> <trans><tr>take it though</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respice vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostende vero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minue vero iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50667.19" n="d" level="4"> To indicate a climax, <hi rend="ital">even</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indeed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque solum in tantis rebus, sed etiam in mediocribus vel studiis vel officiis, vel vero etiam negotiis contemnendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum tam multi homines audissent, statim ad me defertur: immo vero, ut quisque me viderat, narrabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero jam meo nomine abstinent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vero id satis habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50667.20" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a strongly corroborative adversative particle, <hi rend="ital">but in fact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however</hi> (always placed after a word): <cit><quote lang="la">ne T. quidem Postumius contemnendus in dicendo: de re publicā vero non minus vehemens orator, quam bellator fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:77:269" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 77, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vero tam isti (sc. mortui sunt) quam tu ipse, nugator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixisti non auxilium mihi, sed me auxilio defuisse. Ego vero fateor hercule, quod viderim mihi auxilium non deesse, idcirco me illi auxilio pepercisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 35, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi per exploratores Caesar certior factus est, tres jam copiarum partes Helvetios id flumen transduxisse, quartam vero partem citra flumen Ararim reliquam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—In transitions: <cit><quote lang="la">age vero ceteris in rebus quali sit temperantiā, considerate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero tibi de versibus respondebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50667.21" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vērē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">according to truth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">really</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in fact; properly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aright</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quom fit, ibi non vere vivitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 102</bibl></cit> Fleck.: <cit><quote lang="la">honestum, quod proprie vereque dicitur, id in sapientibus est solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis putare vere potest, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere ducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verene hoc memoriae proditum est? etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo, si vere volumus dicere, jam incohavit bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 23, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia vere vates locuta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere an dolo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libentius quam verius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:29:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 29, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ligures latrones verius quam justi hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 27, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verissime loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verissime dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
verutum: <entryFree id="n50668" type="main" key="ve^ru_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrūtum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">verrūtum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>veru</etym>, <sense id="n50668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">javelin</hi>: veruta pila dicuntur quod veluti verua habeant praefixa, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375</bibl> Müll.: cursus quingentos saepe veruti, Enn. ap. Fest. ib. (Ann. v. 356 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 22</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 43, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 409</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:363" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 363</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verutus: <entryFree id="n50669" type="main" key="ve^ru_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕrūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">armed with a dart</hi> or <hi rend="ital">javelin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volsci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 168</bibl></cit>; cf. verutum.</sense></entryFree>
vervactum: <entryFree id="n50670" type="main" key="vervactum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vervactum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vervago</etym>, <sense id="n50670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fallow ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fallow field</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 44, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:32" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:52" default="NO">11, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 176</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vervago: <entryFree id="n50671" type="main" key="verva^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vervăgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. unknown; acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 176</bibl>, from ver-ago</etym>, <sense id="n50671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break up</hi> land, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to plough</hi> land <hi rend="ital">for the first time after its lying fallow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
verveceus: <entryFree id="n50672" type="main" key="Verve_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vervēcĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cĭus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vervex</etym>, <sense id="n50672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has the form of a wether</hi>, an epithet of Jupiter Ammon, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 171</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1043, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vervecinus: <entryFree id="n50673" type="main" key="verve_ci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vervēcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a wether</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Comm. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vervex: <entryFree id="n50674" type="main" key="vervex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vervex</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">berbex</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">verbex</orth>), <itype>ēcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wether.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50674.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=98" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 98</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 189, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50674.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, a name for a stupid fellow, qs. <hi rend="ital">mutton-head</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 6</bibl>; Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 17:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vesaevus: <entryFree id="n50675" type="main" key="Ve^saevus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕsaevus</orth>, v. Vesuvius.</entryFree>
vesania: <entryFree id="n50676" type="main" key="ve_sa_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēsānĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vaesā-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vesanus</etym>, <sense id="n50676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">madness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insanity</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">extimui, ne vos ageret vesania discors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulata (Ulixis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formidabatur flagrans vesania manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 15</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1980" /> <cb n="VESE" /></sense></entryFree>
vesanio: <entryFree id="n50677" type="main" key="ve_sa_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēsānĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vaesā-</orth>), <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>vesanus</etym>, <sense id="n50677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be insane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rave</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">dicebat contra deum vesanire Theodosium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 9, 30</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēsānĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesaniente vento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vesanus: <entryFree id="n50678" type="main" key="ve_sa_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vē-sānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vae-sān-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n50678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not of sound mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insane</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n50678.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">remex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:55:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 55, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunus plebis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella vesani Leonis,</quote> <trans><tr>fierce</tr>, <tr>raging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 29, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50678.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Impetuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem cuidam Alexander donabat vesanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:16:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 496</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50678.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. and abstract things, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 33, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesani murmura ponti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:100:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 100, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mero Regia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 401</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vesbius: <entryFree id="n50679" type="main" key="Vesbi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vesbĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Vesuvius.</entryFree>
vescia: <entryFree id="n50680" type="main" key="Vescia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vescia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little town in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the river Liris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 25</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vescīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Vescia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vescinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 42, 97, § 241</bibl></cit> (al. Vestinus).—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Vescino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vescī-ni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Vescia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vescinians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vescitania: <entryFree id="n50681" type="main" key="Vescita_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vescitānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vesco: <entryFree id="n50682" type="main" key="vesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vescor</etym>, <sense id="n50682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to feed</hi> with any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quis nos vescet carne,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vescendi pupilli causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:5:33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 5, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vescor: <entryFree id="n50683" type="main" key="vescor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vescor</orth>, <itype>vesci</itype>, <sense id="n50683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [ve- and root ed- of edo; cf. esca], <hi rend="ital">to fill one's self with food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eat.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50683.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; syn. pascor), constr. usu. with <case>abl.</case>, rarely with <case>acc.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50683.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">di nec escis aut potionibus vescuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacte, caseo, carne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 89:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 89, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasturtio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 14, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50683.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: eandem vescatur dapem, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 415, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 27</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">caprinum jecur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lauros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:64" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulas (columbas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 31, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmissimos sorte ductos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 28</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare caepas vescendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 20, § 41</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50683.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus (sus) ad vescendum hominibus apta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vescendi causā terrā marique omnia exquirere,</quote> <trans><tr>on account of food</tr>, <tr>to gratify the palate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vescendi gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:8:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vescebatur et ante cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vescere, sodes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphinus ex hominum manu vescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesci in eā (mensā),</quote> <trans><tr>to take his meals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:2:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesci in villā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Capitolio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50683.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to enjoy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make use of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have</hi>, = frui, uti (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): fugimus, qui arce hac vescimur, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 416, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 416, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">vitalibus auris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 857</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aurā Aetheriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 546</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">variante loquelā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemiis patris, Att. ap. Non. p 416, 7: paratissimis voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vesculus: <entryFree id="n50684" type="main" key="vescu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vescŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><lbl>dim.</lbl> of vescus</etym>, <sense id="n50684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trifling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 46</bibl></cit> Ritschl, Fleck., Brix, Wagn. (al. vasculum); v. R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Lat. Part. p. 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vesculi male curati et graciles homines. Ve enim syllabam rei parvae praeponebant, unde Vejovem parvum Jovem et vegrandem fabam minutam dicebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=379" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 379</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
vescus: <entryFree id="n50685" type="main" key="vescus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vescus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contr. from veesca</etym>. <sense id="n50685.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">farra (opp. vegrandia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:445" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 445</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">papaver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 175</bibl></cit> Serv.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 81</bibl></cit>: vires, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 187, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50685.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wretched</hi>: fastidiosum ac vescum vivere, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 186, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50685.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corroding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eating away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 326</bibl></cit> Munro ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
vesentini: <entryFree id="n50686" type="main" key="Vesenti_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vesentīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Etruria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veseris: <entryFree id="n50687" type="main" key="Vese^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vesĕris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a town of the same name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 26:4" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 26, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:28:4" default="NO">28, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vesevus: <entryFree id="n50688" type="main" key="Vese_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vesēvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Vesuvius. <cb n="VESP" /></entryFree>
vesi: <entryFree id="n50689" type="main" key="Ve_si"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vēsi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Visigoths</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 7, 399</bibl>; in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 476</bibl>; 7, 431.</sense></entryFree>
vesica: <entryFree id="n50690" type="main" key="ve_si_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēsīca</orth> (in MSS. often <orth extent="full" lang="la">vensīca</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">vessīca</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bladder</hi> in the body of animals, <hi rend="ital">the urinary bladder.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50690.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:30:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 30, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 8, 21, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 108, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50690.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50690.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Any thing made of bladder</hi>, e. g. <hi rend="ital">a purse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lantern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foot-ball</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 304</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 33, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:14:62" default="NO">8, 14, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem laxis vesicis inligant,</quote> <trans><tr>as a kind of mask to exclude poisonous particles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:27:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 27, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50690.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bladder-like tumor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blister</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50690.5" n="C" level="2"> = pudendum muliebre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:39" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:64" default="NO">6, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50690.6" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inflation</hi> of language, <hi rend="ital">bombast</hi>, = tumor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:49:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 49, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vesicaria: <entryFree id="n50691" type="main" key="ve_si_ca_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēsīcārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. vesicarius, II.</entryFree>
vesicarius: <entryFree id="n50692" type="main" key="ve_si_ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēsīcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vesica</etym>, <sense id="n50692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the bladder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bladder-.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50692.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>curing pain in the bladder</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 146" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 146</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50692.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēsīcārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (herba), <hi rend="ital">a plant that cures pain in the bladder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bladder - wort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 177</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vesicula: <entryFree id="n50693" type="main" key="ve_si_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēsīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little blister</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vesicle;</hi> containing air, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 130</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">containing seeds, on plants,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vesiculosus: <entryFree id="n50694" type="main" key="ve_si_cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēsīcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of bladders</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blisters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vesiculous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:171" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vesontio: <entryFree id="n50695" type="main" key="Ve^sonti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕsontĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Gallia Belgica, <hi rend="ital">the chief town of the Sequani</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Besancon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 39</bibl>; Auson. <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vespa: <entryFree id="n50696" type="main" key="vespa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vespa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sfh/c</foreign>; O. H. Germ. wefsa; Engl. wasp</etym>, <sense id="n50696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wasp</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 21, 24, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:133" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 13, 51, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 13, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vespae: <entryFree id="n50697" type="gloss" key="vespae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vespae</orth> <itype>et vespillones dicuntur, qui funerandis corporibus officium gerunt, non a minutis illis volucribus, sed quia vespertino tempore eos efferunt</itype>, qui funebri pompā duci propter inopiam nequeunt. Hi etiam vespullae vocantur. Martialis: <sense id="n50697.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">qui fuerat medicus, nunc est vespillo Diaulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=369" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 369</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
vespasianus: <entryFree id="n50698" type="main" key="Vespa^si^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vespăsĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: Ti. Flavius Vespasianus, <sense id="n50698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reigned between</hi> 69 <hi rend="ital">and</hi> 79 A. D., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 327</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vespasius: <entryFree id="n50699" type="main" key="Vespasi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vespasĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vespasĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; <cit><quote lang="la">e. g. Vespasia Polla,</quote> <trans><tr>the mother of Vespasian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vespasius Pollio,</quote> <trans><tr>the father of Vespasia Polla</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vesper: <entryFree id="n50700" type="main" key="vesper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vesper</orth>, <itype>ĕris and ĕri</itype> (in class. prose mostly <case>acc.</case> vesperum, and <case>abl.</case> vespere, or adverb. vesperi; the <number>plur.</number> not used), <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n50700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=50" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 50</bibl> and 9, § 73 Müll. acc. to Lachm.) [Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(/speros, e(spe/ra</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">the evening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even-tide.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50700.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam diei vesper erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:106:2" default="NO" valid="yes">106, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesper fit (late Lat. for advesperascit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 14, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vesperum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 92</bibl> Madv.; 3, 2, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub vesperum,</quote> <trans><tr>towards evening</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 33</bibl></cit>; 5, 58; 7, 60; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 42</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">nescis, quid vesper serus vehat, the title of a satire by Varro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:11:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">denique, quid vesper serus vehat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quid vesper ferat, incertum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 8</bibl></cit>: de vesperi suo vivere, <hi rend="ital">on his own supper</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be one's own master</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50700.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <case>abl.</case> adverb., <hi rend="ital">in the evening.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50700.3" n="1" level="3"> Form vespere: <cit><quote lang="la">primo vespere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras reddidit a. d. VIII. Id. Mart. vespere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50700.4" n="2" level="3"> Form vesperi: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad me in Tusculanum heri vesperi venisset Caesar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:20:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 20, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tam vesperi revortor,</quote> <trans><tr>so late</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primā vesperi (sc. horā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50700.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50700.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The evening-star</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 251</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vespero surgente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puro Vespero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50700.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The West</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Occident</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vespere ab atro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—Hence, for <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the West</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Occidentals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:325" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 325</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vespera: <entryFree id="n50701" type="main" key="vespe^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vespĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>= <foreign lang="greek">e(spe/ra</foreign>, i. e. <foreign lang="greek">vespera</foreign>;<cb n="VEST" />  cf. the preced. art.</etym>, <sense id="n50701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the evening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eventide</hi> (much more freq. than vesper; used only in <number>sing.</number>; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic. only adverb., ad vesperam): prima vespera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:4:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 4, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si accelerare volent, ad vesperam consequentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi se occultans perpotavit ad vesperam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 31, 77</bibl></cit>: vespera, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 2, p. 223</bibl> (Hist. 2, 76 Dietsch): <cit><quote lang="la">super sedem cottidianam magistratum primā vesperā suspendit (tabellas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 61, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a mane usque ad vesperam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inumbrante vesperă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 36, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:10" default="NO">5, 13, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:20" default="NO">6, 7, 20</bibl>; 6, 11, 9: vesperā fatigatus, Aur. Caes. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 198</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">vesperā, adverb.,</quote> <trans><tr>in the evening</tr>, <tr>at even</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 18, 32, § 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:183" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 12, 60, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:36" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 4, 14, § 36</bibl>; Fronto ap. Charis. l. l.—</sense><sense id="n50701.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the West</hi> (cf. vesper, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad vesperam jacentes terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 215</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vesperalis: <entryFree id="n50702" type="hapax" key="vespe^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vespĕrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vespera</etym>, <sense id="n50702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to evening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga,</quote> <trans><tr>the west</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vesperasco: <entryFree id="n50703" type="main" key="vespe^rasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vespĕrasco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n50703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [vesper], <hi rend="ital">to become evening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow towards evening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesperascente jam die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesperascente caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesperascit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi jam vesperaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vesperatus: <entryFree id="n50704" type="hapax" key="vespe^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vespĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [vespera], <sense id="n50704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grown into evening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">die jam vesperato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
vesperies: <entryFree id="n50705" type="main" key="Vesperi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vesperĭes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 20, 34, § 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vesperna: <entryFree id="n50706" type="main" key="vesperna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vesperna</orth> <itype>apud Plautum cena intellegitur</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=368" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 368</bibl> Müll.; cf. id. s. v. cena, p. 54; and s. v. scensas, p. 339 [vesper].</entryFree>
vespertilio: <entryFree id="n50707" type="main" key="vesperti_li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vespertīlĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vesper</etym>, <sense id="n50707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 61, 81, § 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:164" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 62, § 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:83" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 26, § 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 16</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 47, 3</bibl>; Auct. Carm. de Philom. 39.</sense></entryFree>
vespertinalis: <entryFree id="n50708" type="main" key="vesperti_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vespertīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = vespertinus (late Lat.), Adaman. Vit. Columb. 3, 30.</entryFree>
vespertinus: <entryFree id="n50709" type="main" key="vesperti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vespertīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vesper</etym>. <sense id="n50709.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to evening</hi> or <hi rend="ital">even-tide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evening-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora (opp. matutina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 52</bibl></cit>: litterae, <hi rend="ital">received in the evening</hi> (opp. antemeridianae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 23, 1</bibl>: senatusconsulta, <hi rend="ital">made</hi> or <hi rend="ital">passed in the evening</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 10, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <trans><tr>a seeing dimly in the evening</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus,</quote> <trans><tr>of the cock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 21, 24, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucubratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 26, 63, § 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ros,</quote> <trans><tr>evening dew</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 13, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.—Adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">si vespertinus subito te oppresserit hospes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the evening</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 113</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 376</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vespertino rursus pascunt,</quote> <trans><tr>at even-tide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matutinis vespertinisque,</quote> <trans><tr>in the morning and evening hours</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 10, 24, § 84</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50709.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the west</hi>, <hi rend="ital">western</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 376</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vesperugo: <entryFree id="n50710" type="main" key="vespe^ru_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vespĕrūgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n50710.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The evening-star</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 12</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=368" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 368</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, 883</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n50710.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bat</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vesperus: <entryFree id="n50711" type="main" key="vespe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vespĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vespera</etym>, <sense id="n50711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the evening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evening-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his horae rigandi matutina atque vespera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 12, 60, § 183</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">al. matutino atque vespera): tempus vesperum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:15:141" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 15, 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:1:15:151" default="NO">1, 15, 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vespices: <entryFree id="n50712" type="gloss" key="vespices"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vespices</orth> <itype>frutecta densa dicta a similitudine vestis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=369" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 369</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
vespillo: <entryFree id="n50713" type="main" key="vespillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vespillo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. vespa</etym>, <sense id="n50713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a corpse-bearer</hi> who carried out the bodies of the poor at night, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:48:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 48, 1</bibl>; cf. vespae.</sense></entryFree>
vesta: <entryFree id="n50714" type="main" key="Vesta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vesta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root vas, to burn; vasaras, day; whence also Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*esti/a</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n50714.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another name for</hi> Ops, Cybele, Terra, <hi rend="ital">the wife of Cœlus and mother of Saturn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:267" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 267</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50714.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Her granddaughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Saturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of flocks and herds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and of the household in general</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 45, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in her temple the holy fire burned perpetually, attended by the Vestal virgins,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 52</bibl>: Vestae sacerdos, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the</hi> Pontifex maximus, of <hi rend="ital">Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:573" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 573</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:778" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 778</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50714.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf. </sense><sense id="n50714.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The temple of Vesta</hi>: quo tempore Vesta Arsit <pb n="1981" /> <cb n="VEST" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:437" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 437</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:234" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 234</bibl>; 6, 713.—</sense><sense id="n50714.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter liquido ardentem perfudit nectare Vestam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 384</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:76" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 76</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vestālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Vesta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vestal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">festi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:395" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 549</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines,</quote> <trans><tr>priestesses of Vesta</tr>, <tr>Vestal virgins</tr>, <tr>Vestals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 14, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 10, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 44</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:14 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 12, 14 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n50714.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50714.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ve-stālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (virgo), <hi rend="ital">a priestess of Vesta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Vestal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:383 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 383 al.</bibl>—Hence, as <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vestales oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Vestals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:311" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 311</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50714.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ve-stālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of Vesta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:3:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 3, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vester: <entryFree id="n50715" type="main" key="vester"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vester</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vost-</orth>), <itype>tra, trum</itype>, <sense id="n50715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. poss.</hi> [vos], <hi rend="ital">your</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voster senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 60</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">al. noster): animi vostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num sermonem vestrum aliquem diremit noster interventus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestra quae dicitur vita mors est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrum est dare, vincere nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:889" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 889</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—For <hi rend="ital">obj. gen.</hi> of vos: <cit><quote lang="la">nec esse in vos odio vestro consultum ab Romanis credatis,</quote> <trans><tr>from hatred towards you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 44, 7</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi voster cenat,</quote> <trans><tr>your master</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego vos de vestro impendatis hortor?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: vostrorum, vostrarum, full form of <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi>, from which vostrum (vestrum), used as <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of vos, is contracted; the full form is found <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pars vostrorum intellegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neutram vostrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vestiarius: <entryFree id="n50716" type="main" key="vesti^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vestis</etym>, <sense id="n50716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to clothes.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50716.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arca,</quote> <trans><tr>a clotheschest</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiator,</quote> <trans><tr>a clothesdealer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 1, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50716.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50716.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ve-stĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a clothes-dealer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:3:5:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 3, 5, § 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3643</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4294</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n50716.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vestĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n50716.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A clothes-press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothes-chest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wardrobe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 8, 8, § 33</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50716.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Articles of clothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wardrobe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:3:3 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 3, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
vestibulum: <entryFree id="n50717" type="main" key="vesti^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestĭbŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. for vesti-bulum, kindr. with Sanscr. vas, habitare, commorari; cf. Vesta</etym>, <sense id="n50717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the enclosed space between the entrance of a house and the street</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fore-court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entrance-court</hi> (cf. atrium). </sense><sense id="n50717.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 12, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:66:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 66, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 26, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:303" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 303</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:126 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 126 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50717.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">an entrance</hi> to any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gallinarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:3" default="NO">8, 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvearii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:12:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siciliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66, § 170</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50717.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an entrance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beginning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestibula nimirum honesta aditusque ad causam faciet illustres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:15:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 15, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestibulum modo artis alicujus ingredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl>, praef. § 18; 9, 4, 10.</sense></entryFree>
vesticeps: <entryFree id="n50718" type="main" key="vesti^ceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestĭceps</orth>, <itype>cĭpis</itype> <etym>vestis-capio, that has got the first covering of the chin, opp. investis</etym>, <sense id="n50718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrived at puberty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virile</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n50718.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrogari non potest nisi jam vesticeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:19:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 19, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 4, 73</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n50718.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">immoral</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupt</hi> (opp. investis, innocent), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 336, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vesticola: <entryFree id="n50719" type="main" key="Vesti^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vestĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Vesta-colo</etym>, <sense id="n50719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Vestal virgin</hi> (late Lat.), Drac. Carm. 7, 22.</sense></entryFree>
vesticontubernium: <entryFree id="n50720" type="hapax" key="vesti^contu^berni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestĭ-contŭbernĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vestis</etym>, <sense id="n50720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lying under the same coverlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleeping in the same bed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bed - companionship</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vesticula: <entryFree id="n50721" type="main" key="vesti^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little garment</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:18:section=13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 18, § 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vestifica: <entryFree id="n50722" type="gloss" key="vesti^fi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestĭfĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vestis-facio</etym>, <sense id="n50722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that makes garments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tailoress</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2437</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vestificina: <entryFree id="n50723" type="hapax" key="vesti^fi^ci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestĭfĭcīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>‡ vestificus</etym>, <sense id="n50723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making of garments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tailoring</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
vestificus: <entryFree id="n50724" type="gloss" key="vesti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vestis-facio</etym>, <sense id="n50724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of garments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tailor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 578, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vestifluus: <entryFree id="n50725" type="main" key="vesti^flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestĭflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vestis-fluo</etym>, <sense id="n50725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that wears long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowing garments</hi> (a late <usg type="style">poet.</usg> word): <cit><quote lang="la">Lydus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ser,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Technop. Hist. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vestigatio: <entryFree id="n50726" type="main" key="vesti_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestīgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vestigo</etym>, <sense id="n50726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tracing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">searching after</hi> (post-class.): Psyche <cb n="VEST" /> dies noctesque mariti vestigationibus inquieta, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vestigator: <entryFree id="n50727" type="main" key="vesti_ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestīgātor</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">vestīgĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vestigo</etym>, <sense id="n50727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tracker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tracer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">searcher</hi> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">vestigator a vestigiis ferarum, quas indagatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=94" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 94</bibl></cit> Müll. (where the read. is vestigiator); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:8:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:26:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vestigium: <entryFree id="n50728" type="main" key="vesti_gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestīgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a footstep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">step; footprint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foot-track</hi>, <hi rend="ital">track.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50728.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">currentium pes vestigium facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac socci video vestigium in pulvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 4, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foro vestigium facere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to set foot in the market</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 17, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere vestigium in possessione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigiis persequi aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:307" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 90, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigiis sequi hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 45, 16</bibl></cit>: eodem remanere vestigio, <hi rend="ital">to stay in the same spot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">negans e republicā esse, vestigium abscedi ab Hannibale,</quote> <trans><tr>the distance of a step</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus ille, quem mente noscimus, atque in animi notione tamquam in vestigio volumus reponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:14:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.
