D. 1, 14, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50728.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50728.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The part of the foot which makes a print</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sole of the foot</hi>: qui adversis vestigiis stent contra nostra vestigia, quos <foreign lang="greek">a)nti/podas</foreign> vocatis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 566</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50728.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A horseshoe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigium equi excussum ungulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 20, 81, § 263</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50728.5" n="3" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a trace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vestige</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim cum in lectulo decumanae mulieris vestigia viderent recentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:34:section=79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 34, § 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vestigiis hujus urbis,</quote> <trans><tr>ruins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semiruta murorum vestigia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50728.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of manners, cha racter, etc., <hi rend="ital">a footprint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a pueritiā vestigiis ingressus patriis et tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:24:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 24, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imprimi quaedam vestigia animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patris patruique vestigia premere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—</hi></sense><sense id="n50728.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of time, <hi rend="ital">a point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem et loci vestigio et temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illo vestigio temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigio temporis,</quote> <trans><tr>at the moment</tr>, <tr>instantly</tr>, <tr>forthwith</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut urbs ab hostibus capta eodem vestigio videretur,</quote> <trans><tr>at that very moment</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50728.8" n="b" level="4"> A dverb.: e (ex) vestigio, <hi rend="ital">instantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forthwith</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente e vestigio ex homine tamquam aliquo Circaeo poculo factus est Verres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:17:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17, 57</bibl></cit>; Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
vestigo: <entryFree id="n50729" type="main" key="vesti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ve-stīgo</orth>, no <sense id="n50729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. Sanscr. vahis (bahis), out, and stigh-, to climb; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sti/xos</foreign>, a row, etc.; Angl. -Sax. stīgan; Germ. steigen, to climb</etym>. </sense><sense id="n50729.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to follow in the track of; to track</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trace out</hi> (cf.: rimor, indago, scrutor): germana soror, errare videbar, Tardaque vestigare et quaerere te, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 43 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">feras vestigat (sc. canis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 496" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 496</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">fertur (sc. tigris) praeceps, odore vestigans (sc. raptorem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 18, 25, § 66</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50729.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50729.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To find out by tracing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to trace out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discover.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50729.4" n="1" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfugas et fugitivos, quos inquirendo vestigare potuerint, reddidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cervi) vestigant cavernas (serpentium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis enim jacens piscis magis naribus escam, quam oculis, vestigat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50729.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimissis deinde per agros, qui vestigarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 26, 13</bibl></cit> dub.; cf. Weissenb. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n50729.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To search after; to seek out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterum Alexander, quam regionem Dareus petisset, omni curā vestigans, tamen explorare non poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo sicca lacuna, ut vestigantium sitim falleret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum vestigari jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo alte vestiga (sc. ramum) oculis, riteque repertum Carpe manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50729.7" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50729.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To inquire into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigate</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n50729.9" n="1" level="3"> In simple constr.: <cit><quote lang="la">causas rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 166</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50729.10" n="2" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā (sc. ratione) omnes illorum conatūs vestigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 16, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50729.11" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum desidiosā delectatione vestiges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:23:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 23, 88</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50729.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To discover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">find out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grave imperium regum nihil inexploratum, quod vestigari volunt, efficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:51:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 51, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vestimentum: <entryFree id="n50730" type="main" key="vesti_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vestis</etym>, <sense id="n50730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a garment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vestment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bedclothes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tapestry</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4</bibl>, <cb n="VEST" /> 25, 13; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestiva, hiberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 67:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 67, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:78:21" default="NO">78, 21</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 47; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:B. Hisp. 33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Hisp. 33</bibl>.—Prov.: nudo detrahere vestimenta, <hi rend="ital">to strip the naked</hi> (of any thing impossible), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vestini: <entryFree id="n50731" type="main" key="Vesti_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vestīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Central Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Adriatic Sea</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 28, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 107</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vestīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Vestini</hi>: Vestina virum vis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 251</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 280 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:516" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 516</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:181" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 425</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vestio: <entryFree id="n50732" type="main" key="vesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype> (<sense id="n50732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> vestibat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 160</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> vestirier, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 39</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vestis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to cover with a garment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vest</hi> (syn.: induo, amicio). </sense><sense id="n50732.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Vatinii strumam sacerdotii <foreign lang="greek">diba/fw(</foreign> vestiant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir te vestiat, tu virum despolies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candide vestitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos tam maestiter vestitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines male vestiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasciae, quibus crura vestiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:144" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te bis Afro Murice tinctae Vestiunt lanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic Indos suae arbores vestiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 11, 22, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrygiā vestitur bucca tiarā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:516" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 516</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unam vestire tribum tua vellera possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:46:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 46, 5</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: vestiri in foro honeste mos erat, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lino alii vestiuntur aut lanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—So, in late Lat., in the active form: <cit><quote lang="la">tu mihi vitio dabis, quod parcius pasco, levius vestio,</quote> <trans><tr>am clothed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 287, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50732.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50732.3" n="1" level="3"> Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">animantes aliae coriis tectae sunt, aliae villis vestitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sandyx pascentis vestiet agnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque contra frigus ex suo corpore vestiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50732.4" n="2" level="3"> In gen., of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">to clothe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">array</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">campos lumine (aether),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura oculos membranis tenuissimis vestivit et saepsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deus animum circumdedit corpore et vestivit extrinsecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrum saeptum undique et vestitum vepribus et dumetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his tabulis templi parietes vestiebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:55:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 55, § 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50732.5" n="3" level="3"> Esp., of vegetation: <cit><quote lang="la">montes silvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vite hederāque vestiti montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:7:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes vestiti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>covered with verdure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:53:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 53, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes multo aggere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the beard: molli lanugine malas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:889" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 889</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genas flore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleā magnum Taburnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramine vestitis accubuere toris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:402" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendit vestitos messibus agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:707" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 707</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl> (4, 12), 31: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi se vites frondibus vestierint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:27:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se gramine (terra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 219</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50732.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to clothe</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">reconditas exquisitasque sententias mollis et pellucens vestiebat oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventa vestire atque ornare oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriā aliquem supra vires,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res, quae illo verborum habitu vestiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, praef. § 20; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of mental culture: aridum atque jejunum non alemus et quasi vestiemus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50732.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to invest</hi> with the imperial purple, <hi rend="ital">to make emperor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaere quem vestias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vestītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">clothed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clad</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">neque unā pelle vestitior fuit (Hercules),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 288, 28</bibl></cit>.—So <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 38</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id pecus (oves) ex omnibus animalibus vestitissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vestiplica: <entryFree id="n50733" type="main" key="vesti^pli^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestĭplĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vestis-plico</etym>, <sense id="n50733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (female) <hi rend="ital">clothes-folder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ironer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laundress</hi> (anteand post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pseudo</author> Quint. Decl. 363</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3315</bibl>; cf. vestiplicus and vestispica.</sense></entryFree>
vestiplicus: <entryFree id="n50734" type="gloss" key="vestipli^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestiplĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clothes-folder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ironer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2839</bibl>; cf. the preced. art.</sense></entryFree>
vestis: <entryFree id="n50735" type="main" key="vestis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root vas-, to put on; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(s-, ves-</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">e(/nnumi, e)sqh/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n50735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the covering for the body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vesture</hi> (syn. amictus; in class. prose only <number>sing.</number>). </sense><sense id="n50735.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: lavere lacrimis vestem squalam et sordidam, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 172, 20</bibl> (Trag. v. 370 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem cum auro et veste abducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satin' haec me vestis deceat,</quote> <trans><tr>these clothes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1982" /> <cb n="VESU" /> 10: <cit><quote lang="la">discidit vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lugubris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vestem muliebrem conficiendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:46:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 46, § 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptā veste virili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 38 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50735.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp.: mutare vestem. </sense><sense id="n50735.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To put on mourning garments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put on mourning</hi> (cf. sordidatus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid vestis mutatio'st?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dolorem suum vestis mutatione declarandum censuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 8, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50735.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Also in gen., <hi rend="ital">to change</hi> one's <hi rend="ital">clothing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:41:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 41, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50735.5" n="3" level="3"> In <number>sing.</number> collect., = vestes: <cit><quote lang="la">multam pretiosam supellectilem vestemque missam Carthaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 21, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 6, 7</bibl>; 44, 26, 9.—</sense><sense id="n50735.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garments</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">aurum vestibus illitum Mirata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picturatae auri subtemine vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestibus extentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:68" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in vestes, margarita, gemmas fuerat erogaturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 16, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:4" default="NO">9, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:31" default="NO">11, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:10" default="NO">5, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:9:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 7, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:7:20:2" default="NO">7, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 68</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50735.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of any sort of covering. </sense><sense id="n50735.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A carpet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tapestry</hi> (syn. stragulum): <cit><quote lang="la">in plebeiā veste cubandum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 659</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 106 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n50735.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50735.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A veil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:244" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 244</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50735.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The skin</hi> of a serpent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 61</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 614</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50735.12" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The beard</hi> as the <hi rend="ital">covering</hi> of the chin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 673</bibl> (cf. vesticeps and investis).—</sense><sense id="n50735.13" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A spider's web</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 386</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vestispica: <entryFree id="n50736" type="main" key="vesti^spi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestĭspĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vestis-spicio</etym>, <sense id="n50736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that has the care of clothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wardrobewoman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 22</bibl> (Ritschl, Fleck., and Brix, vestiplica, q. v.); Afran. and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 12, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vestitor: <entryFree id="n50737" type="main" key="vesti_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vestio</etym>. <sense id="n50737.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A maker of clothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tailor</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1111, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1842, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50737.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A clother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dresser</hi>: divinorum simulacrorum, Firm. Math. 3, 11, 9.</sense></entryFree>
vestitus: <entryFree id="n50738" type="main" key="vesti_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of vestio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50739" type="main" key="vesti_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vestio</etym>, <sense id="n50739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apparel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raiment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vesture.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50739.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: hoc cum vestitu, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 537, 28</bibl> (Trag. v. 373 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">immutabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 49, 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsoletior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutare vestitum = mutare vestem,</quote> <trans><tr>to put on mourning garments</tr>, <tr>to put on mourning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 14, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 15, 5</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">on the contrary: redire ad suum vestitum,</quote> <trans><tr>to resume one's ordinary clothing</tr>, <tr>to lay off mourning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: vestitu (<case>dat.</case>) nimio indulges, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 38</bibl>.—Abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">me saturum servire apud te sumptu et vestitu tuo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with the clothing that you give</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50739.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. things, <hi rend="ital">covering</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">adde huc liquores perlucidos amnium, riparum vestitus viridissimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densissimi montium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 64, 161</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n50739.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:327" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 95, 327</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vestorius: <entryFree id="n50740" type="main" key="Vestori^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vestorĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n50740.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An artist of Puteoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 11 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vestorĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Vestorius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 13, 57, § 162</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 17</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50740.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A friend of Cicero</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 16</bibl>, a, 4; 6, 2, 3.</sense></entryFree>
vestras: <entryFree id="n50741" type="gloss" key="vestras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vestras</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>vester</etym>, <sense id="n50741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of your family</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nation</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 133</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 317</bibl> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1095</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
vesulus: <entryFree id="n50742" type="main" key="Ve^su^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕsŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Liguria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monte Viso</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 708</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vesuni: <entryFree id="n50743" type="main" key="Vesuni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vesuni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Libya</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 1, § 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vesuvius: <entryFree id="n50744" type="main" key="Ve^su^vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕsŭvĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ve and <foreign lang="greek">sbe-</foreign>, root of <foreign lang="greek">sbe/nnumi</foreign>; v. Lidd. and Scott s. v.</etym>, <sense id="n50744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated volcano in Campania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 6, 12</bibl>.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕsēvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Vĕsaev-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8</bibl>; id. Vit. Plin.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:8:5" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:507" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 507</bibl>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">Vesevo jugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 224</bibl></cit> (Rib. Vesaevo); <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 184</bibl>.—Contr. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vesvĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vesbĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:44:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 44, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:79" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:655" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 655</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17" default="NO">17</bibl>, <cb n="VETE" /> 598; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:209" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 209</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕsŭvī-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Vesuvius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vesuvian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:72" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 62</bibl></cit>; 5, 3, 205.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕsēvīnus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—Contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vesbīnus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:152" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veter: <entryFree id="n50745" type="main" key="ve^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕter</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, v. vetus <sense id="n50745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vetera: <entryFree id="n50746" type="main" key="Ve^te^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕtĕra</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n50746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of</hi> Gallia Belgica, now <hi rend="ital">Xanten</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 45</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Vetera castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 18</bibl></cit> and 21.</sense></entryFree>
veteramentarius: <entryFree id="n50747" type="hapax" key="ve^te^ra_menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrāmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vetus</etym>, <sense id="n50747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to old things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sutor,</quote> <trans><tr>a mender of old shoes</tr>, <tr>cobbler</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veteranus: <entryFree id="n50748" type="main" key="ve^te^ra_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veteran</hi> (in technical lang.): <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:20:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:15:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: miles veteranus, or simply veteranus, <hi rend="ital">an old tried soldier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a veteran soldier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a veteran</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 14, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 39, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:33:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 33, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:5:24:1" default="NO">5, 24, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones veteranae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>composed of veterans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50748.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">experienced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteranis manibus libros evolvite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veterarius: <entryFree id="n50749" type="main" key="ve^te^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mature</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam non contenti vina diffundere, veteraria per sapores aetatesque disponere invenimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:13:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">veteraria nostra et plena multorum saeculorum vindemiis horrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 114, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veterasco: <entryFree id="n50750" type="main" key="ve^te^rasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrasco</orth>, <itype>rāvi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n50750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to grow old</hi>: veterascens ad gloriam, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 437, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pati aliquid veterascere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: ut nec vestimenta veterascerent, etc., <hi rend="ital">wear out</hi>, Ambros. de Fide, 2, 2, 23: <cit><quote lang="la">cum febres veteraverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 12, 6</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. inveter-); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 1, 8</bibl> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">Haase, verterunt): et omnes sicut vestimentum veterascent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:101:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 101, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veterator: <entryFree id="n50751" type="main" key="ve^te^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>veteratus</etym>, <sense id="n50751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has grown old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become gray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is practised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilled</hi> in any thing. </sense><sense id="n50751.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in causis privatis satis veterator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:178" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 48, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:1:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50751.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50751.3" n="A" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a crafty fellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an old fox</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sly-boots</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acutus, versutus, veterator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:16:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 16, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hic vult veterator sibi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 13, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 32, 113</bibl>; Gannius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=369" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 369</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50751.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An old slave</hi> (opp. novitius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:65" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:37" default="NO">21, 1, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veteratorie: <entryFree id="n50752" type="main" key="ve^te^ra_to_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrātōrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. veteratorius <sense id="n50752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
veteratorius: <entryFree id="n50753" type="main" key="ve^te^ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>veterator, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n50753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crafty. cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sly</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ab isto tectum, nihil veteratorium exspectaveritis: omnia aperta, omnia perspicua reperientur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54:section=141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54, § 141</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ratio dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:261" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 75, 261</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrātōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">craftily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunningly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slyly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere (with acute),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veteratrix: <entryFree id="n50754" type="hapax" key="ve^te^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>veterator</etym>, <sense id="n50754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sorceress</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230, 24</bibl> (al. veratrix).</sense></entryFree>
veteratus: <entryFree id="n50755" type="main" key="ve^te^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrātus</orth>, <pos>P. a.</pos> of vetero.</entryFree>
veteretum: <entryFree id="n50756" type="main" key="ve^te^re_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vetus</etym>, <sense id="n50756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ground that has long lain fallow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old fallow ground</hi>, = vervactum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 4</bibl> and 5; 2, 13, 2.</sense></entryFree>
veterinarius: <entryFree id="n50757" type="main" key="ve^te^ri_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>veterinus</etym>, <sense id="n50757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to beasts of burden and draught.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50757.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicina,</quote> <trans><tr>farriery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50757.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n50757.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a cattle-doctor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farrier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veterinarian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:14" default="NO">7, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:12" default="NO">11, 1, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50757.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕ-rīnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a place for taking care of diseased animals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Grom. p. 12" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Grom. p. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veterinus: <entryFree id="n50758" type="main" key="ve^te^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contr. from vehiterinus, from veho; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=369" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 369</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n50758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to carrying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drawing burdens.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50758.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: bestia, <hi rend="ital">a beast of burden</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draught</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=369" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 369</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also pecus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 46, 106, § 255</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence also: semen equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:890" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 890</bibl></cit> (887); so, <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:865" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 865</bibl></cit> (862).—</sense><sense id="n50758.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕrīnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕ-tĕrīna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">draught-cattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beasts of burden</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:38:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 38, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 64, § 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:265" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 50, 111, § 265</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50758.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to beasts of burden</hi>: ars, <hi rend="ital">the art of healing domestic animals</hi>, Veg. Vet. praef. 1.</sense></entryFree>
veternositas: <entryFree id="n50759" type="hapax" key="ve^terno_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕternōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>veternosus</etym>, <sense id="n50759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lethargy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somnolency</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
veternosus: <entryFree id="n50760" type="main" key="ve^terno_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕternōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>veternus, II. C.</etym>, <sense id="n50760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">afflicted with lethargy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lethargic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50760.1" n="I" level="1"> <cb n="VETO" /> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 4, 13, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:230" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 17, 67, § 230</bibl>; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 9</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=369" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 369</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50760.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sleepy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drowsy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreamy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50760.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">languid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spiritless</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 48" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 48</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veternosissimi artificii nodos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veternus: <entryFree id="n50761" type="main" key="ve^ternus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕternus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vetus</etym>, <sense id="n50761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of great age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancient</hi> (only post-class.). </sense><sense id="n50761.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50761.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕter-nus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> * </sense><sense id="n50761.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Old age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">age</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:94" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50761.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Old dirt</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 223</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50761.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lethargy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somnolence</hi> (as a disease of aged people). </sense><sense id="n50761.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">num eum veternus aut aqua intercus tenet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Of the deep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long sleep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">torpidity</hi> of bears, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 127</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50761.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">drowsiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggishness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sloth</hi> (freq., but not in Cic.), Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 4</bibl> (cited ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 3</bibl>); <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:4" default="NO">7, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 357</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n50762" type="main" key="ve^ternus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕternus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 1. veternus, II.</entryFree>
vetero: <entryFree id="n50763" type="main" key="ve^te^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vetus</etym>, <sense id="n50763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make old</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">dicendo autem novum veteravit prius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 8, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕ-tĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inveterate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mederi ulceribus veteratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 52, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <trans><tr>mouldy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 140" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vetitum: <entryFree id="n50764" type="main" key="ve^ti^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. veto <sense id="n50764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vetitus: <entryFree id="n50765" type="main" key="ve^ti^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of veto.</entryFree>
veto: <entryFree id="n50766" type="main" key="ve^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕto</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 1</itype> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏto</orth>: <sense id="n50766.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">votes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">votitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 45, 4</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.) vetavit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:90" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 16, 6</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">not to suffer</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">to take place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to permit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to advise against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forbid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prohibit</hi> a thing; and, with a personal object, <hi rend="ital">not to permit</hi> one <hi rend="ital">to do</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to prevent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi> him <hi rend="ital">from doing</hi> it, <hi rend="ital">not to grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to forbid</hi> him a thing, etc. (syn.: interdico, inhibeo); constr. most freq. with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, less freq. with the simple <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, the simple <case>acc.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or the simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50766.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n50766.2" n="a" level="4"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex peregrinum vetat in murum ascendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 100</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (lex naturae) vetat ullam rem esse cujusquam, nisi ejus, qui tractare et uti sciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab opere legatos Caesar discedere vetuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes a te collectae vetabant, me rei publicae penitus diffidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridentem dicere verum Quid vetat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non me ulla vetabunt Frigora Parthenios canibus circumdare saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos vetuit me numerare timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit> (3, 27), 4; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 32 (3, 30), 8: cum leges duo ex unā familiā non solum magistratus creari vetarent, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra ... vallo muniri vetuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (lex) de capite civis Romani nisi comitiis centuriatis statui vetaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:36:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 36, 61</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum equites Romani flere pro me edictis vetarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. Quir. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterni vetabere terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nolani muros portasque adire vetiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redemptoribus vetitis frumentum parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut a praefecto morum Hasdrubal cum eo vetaretur esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 470</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:371" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 371</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50766.3" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or the simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sive jubebat, Ut faceret quid, Sive vetabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edicto vetuit, ne quis se praeter Apellen Pingeret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 239</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetabo, qui Cereris sacrum Vulgarit arcanae, sub isdem Sit trabibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:36" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50766.4" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi> (ante- and postclass. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nemo hinc prohibet nec votat, Quin quod palam'st venale, emas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1</bibl>, praef. 17.—</sense><sense id="n50766.5" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">at haec (sapientiā) nullā re, quo minus se exerceat, vetari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50766.6" n="e" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae peccare vetantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec laevus vetet ire picus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 27, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde proferre pedem pudor vetet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 135</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:91:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 91, 1</bibl>: quid vetat? with a foll. <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:295" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 295</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ait esse vetitum intro ad eram accedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6</bibl></cit> (7), 24.—</sense><sense id="n50766.7" n="f" level="4"> With <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n50766.8" n="(a)" level="5"> Of the thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quia bella vetabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec majora veto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:541" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 541</bibl></cit>: quid jubeatve vetetve, id. M. <pb n="1983" /> <cb n="VETU" /> 11, 493: <cit><quote lang="la">iter mediis natura vetabat Syrtibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristia damna vetabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:173" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 173</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:304" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 304</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem vetuit Delia tardior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 150" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus Phoebum vetat,</quote> <trans><tr>keeps off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1624" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1624</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossam praeduxit, quā incerta Oceani vetarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ludere) vetitā legibus aleā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetiti hymenaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 623</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetitae terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:4:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum vetitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetito ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1585" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1585</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50766.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Of the person: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Graecos facerem Versiculos, vetuit me tali voce Quirinus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos vetat igne Creon,</quote> <trans><tr>keeps off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:558" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 558</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta agimus: quod vetamur vetere proverbio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 22, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustissimi mortalium nihil per metum vetabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter eandem causam facere debebimus, propter quam vetamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe vetor fatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mathematici, genus hominum, quod in civitate nostrā et vetabitur semper et retinebitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50766.10" n="g" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex omnis aut jubet aut vetat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: optat supremo collocare Sisyphus In monte saxum; <cit><quote lang="la">sed vetant leges Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:69" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ipsa vetat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a patria pelago vela vetante datis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 131</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50766.11" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: veto, <hi rend="ital">I forbid it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I protest;</hi> the word with which the tribunes of the people declared their protest against any measure of the Senate or of the magistrates, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 35, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vim fieri vetarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:12:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 12, 9</bibl></cit>.—Of the protest of the praetor against any unlawful measure, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 13, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 14</bibl>. —And in the lang. of augury: <cit><quote lang="la">vetat haruspex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:38:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 38, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vetet auspicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:764" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 764</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕtĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n50766.12" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which is forbidden</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prohibited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a forbidden</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prohibited thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitimur in vetitum semper cupimusque negata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed jam de vetito quisque parabat opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:282" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venerem In vetitis numerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebrescit occultis primum sermonibus, ut vetita solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agebat quaedam vetita legibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50766.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A prohibition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa ac vetita populorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae contra vetitum discordia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vettius: <entryFree id="n50767" type="main" key="Vettius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vettius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vat. 10, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vettones: <entryFree id="n50768" type="main" key="Vetto_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vettōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. Vectones.</entryFree>
vettonica: <entryFree id="n50769" type="main" key="vetto^ni^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vettŏnĭca</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">beto-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the betony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 46, § 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vetulonia: <entryFree id="n50770" type="main" key="Ve^tu^lo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕtŭlōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Etruria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:485" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 485</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n50770.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕtŭlōnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Vetulonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 227</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50770.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vetŭlōnĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Vetulonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
