C. 1, 24</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50807.2" n="2" level="3"> Vibius Crispus, <hi rend="ital">an orator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 48</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 2, p. 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vibo: <entryFree id="n50808" type="main" key="vibo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vibo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the flower of the herb called</hi> Britannica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 3, 6, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50809" type="main" key="Vibo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vibo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vibon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the territory of the Bruttii</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monteleone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 645</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vibōnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Vibo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 51, 4</bibl></cit> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 6, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vibrabilis: <entryFree id="n50810" type="main" key="vi_^bra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^brābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vibro</etym>. * <sense id="n50810.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That may be brandished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornus (i. e. hasta),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 24, 108</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n50810.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Quivering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glimmering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vibrabundus: <entryFree id="n50811" type="hapax" key="vi_^bra_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^brābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tremulous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glimmering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mercurius (stella),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 880</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vibramen: <entryFree id="n50812" type="hapax" key="vi_^bra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^brāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tremulous motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quivering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trisulca draconum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 179, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vibratio: <entryFree id="n50813" type="main" key="vi_^bra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^brātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brandishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vibration</hi>: hastae, Fest. s. v. gradivus, p. 97: continuata tonitruum, Calp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vibratus: <entryFree id="n50814" type="main" key="vi_^bra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^brātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of vibro.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50815" type="main" key="vi_^bra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^brātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vibro</etym>, <sense id="n50815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quivering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tremulous motion</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">luminis,</quote> <trans><tr>flickering</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 887</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebri ignium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>, § 66.</sense></entryFree>
vibrissae: <entryFree id="n50816" type="gloss" key="vi_^brissae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^brissae</orth> <itype>pili in naribus hominum, dicti quod his evulsis caput vibratur</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=370" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 370</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
vibrisso: <entryFree id="n50817" type="main" key="vi_^brisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^brisso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n50817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shake the voice</hi> (in singing), <hi rend="ital">to trill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vibrissare est vocem in cantando crispare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=370" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 370</bibl></cit> Müll.; Titin. ap. Fest. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
vibro: <entryFree id="n50818" type="main" key="vi_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vī^bro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. Sanscr. vip, to tremble</etym>. <sense id="n50818.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set in tremulous motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to move rapidly to and fro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to brandish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate</hi> (class.; syn.: quatio, ventilo). </sense><sense id="n50818.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas ante pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamina vestes,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause to flutter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 528</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epith. 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multifidas linguas (draco),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:61" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremor vibrat ossa,</quote> <trans><tr>makes tremble</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera vibrantur (equitando),</quote> <trans><tr>are shaken about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impositus scuto more gentis et sustinentium umeris vibratus, dux eligitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitis vibratis jactare sententias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:120" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thyrsum manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 420" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens squalidum crista caput vibrans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1254" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 1254</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vibrata flammis aequora,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>glimmering</tr>, <tr>sparkling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:306" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines vibrati,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>curled</tr>, <tr>frizzled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 78, 80, § 189</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: sic mea vibrari pallentia membra videres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50818.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to throw with a vibratory motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to launch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurl</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicas et spargere venena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferti et quasi cohaerentes tela vibrare non poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremulum excusso jaculum lacerto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per auras spicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina (Juppiter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:308" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 308</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vibratus ab aethere fulgor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculum ex arborum ramis vibrari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 23, 35, § 85</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50818.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50818.4" n="1" level="3"> Of language, <hi rend="ital">to fling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">launch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">truces vibrare iambos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 36, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. 2. vibratus, II.—</sense><sense id="n50818.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To threaten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela undique mortem vibrantia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 13, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50818.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in tremulous motion</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n50818.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50818.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vibrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tremble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguā vibrante (serpentis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 657</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae motus non simplici modo quatitur, sed tremit vibratque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 80, 82, § 194</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50818.9" n="2" level="3"> Of the voice or sounds, <hi rend="ital">to tremble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(haec vox) sonat adhuc et vibrat in auribus meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus lusciniae vibrans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querelā adhuc vibrante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusmodi fabulae vibrabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50818.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To glimmer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gleam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scintillate</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">mare, quā a sole collucet, albescit et vibrat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 105</bibl></cit>: <cb n="VICE" /> signa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tremulo vibrant incendia ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:664" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 664</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:583" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 583</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:342" default="NO">2, 342</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 2</bibl>.—Of bright weapons: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes Tela tenent dextrā lato vibrantia ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 342</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 769</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum Vibranti medium cuspis transverberat ictu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 484</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50818.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of language: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (Demosthenis) non tam vibrarent fulmina illa, nisi numeris contorta ferrentur,</quote> <trans><tr>would not have been hurled with such vigor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:70:234" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 70, 234</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio incitata et vibrans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:326" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 95, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:120" default="NO">11, 3, 120</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭbrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">impetuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forcible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iambus flammis fulminis vibratior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 21, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vibullius: <entryFree id="n50819" type="main" key="Vi_bulli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vībullĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; <cit><quote lang="la">e. g. L. Vibullius,</quote> <trans><tr>a partisan of Pompey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viburnum: <entryFree id="n50820" type="main" key="vi_burnum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīburnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n50820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wayfaring-tree</hi>: Viburnum lantana, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vicanus: <entryFree id="n50821" type="main" key="vi_ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcānus</orth> (post-class. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">vī-cānĕus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 56</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vicus</etym>, <sense id="n50821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dwelling in a village.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50821.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tmolites ille vicanus,</quote> <trans><tr>villager</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: haruspices, <hi rend="ital">who go about from village to village</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50821.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">villagers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peasants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 30, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vica: <entryFree id="n50822" type="main" key="Vi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭca Pŏta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vinco- potior</etym>, <sense id="n50822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Victress-and-possessor</hi>, an appellation of the Goddess of Victory, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diespiter, Vicae Potae filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Lud. Most. Claud. 9:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Lud. Most. Claud. 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vicaria: <entryFree id="n50823" type="main" key="vi^ca_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭcārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. vicarius, II. B.</entryFree>
vicarianus: <entryFree id="n50824" type="main" key="vi^ca_ri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭcārĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vicarius</etym>, <sense id="n50824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a deputy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vicar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicarial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparitores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 35, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apex,</quote> <trans><tr>the rank of a vicar</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vicarius: <entryFree id="n50825" type="main" key="vi^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vicis</etym>, <sense id="n50825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that supplies the place</hi> of a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">substituted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delegated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicarious.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50825.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicaria fides amicorum supponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 6:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 16:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 243" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 243</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50825.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50825.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a substitute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deputy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proxy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a locum tenens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicegerent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">succedam ego vicarius tuo muneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:37:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 37, § 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 38, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 37, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 9, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:39:section=16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 39, § 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentiae meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">an adjutant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lieutenant</hi> to a military commander, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 51, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni,</quote> <trans><tr>a vice - tribune</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Trig. Tyr. 10, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">An under-servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">underslave</hi> kept by another slave, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:18:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 18, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:1:17" default="NO">15, 1, 17</bibl>; Inscr. Marin. Fratr. Arv. 687; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the vicarii of such vicarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:775" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 775</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50825.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭcārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n50825.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A female under-slave</hi> of another slave, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 304</bibl>, n. 297; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 972, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50825.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The post of deputy of the</hi> praefectus praetorio, Cod. Th. 6, 26, 4.—</sense><sense id="n50825.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A substitute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se pro conjuge vicariam dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Helv. 19:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Helv. 19, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vicatim: <entryFree id="n50826" type="main" key="vi_ca_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>vicus</etym>. <sense id="n50826.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">From street to street</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through the streets</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 188, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:97" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 97</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50826.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">From village to village</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through the villages</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in hamlets</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispersa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 117</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vice: <entryFree id="n50827" type="main" key="vi^ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭce</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭcem</orth>, v. vicis.</entryFree>
vicenalis: <entryFree id="n50828" type="hapax" key="vi_ce_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcēnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>viceni</etym>, <sense id="n50828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing the number twenty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaera,</quote> <trans><tr>having twenty angles</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 5, 14</bibl></cit> (just before, vigintiangula).</sense></entryFree>
vicenarius: <entryFree id="n50829" type="main" key="vi_ce_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the number twenty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicenary.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50829.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annorum lex me perdit quina vicenaria: metuunt credere omnes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the law by which young people under five-and-twenty were incapable of making contracts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 69</bibl></cit> (Ritschl, quinavicenaria): <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <trans><tr>twenty quarter-digits in diameter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 30" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50829.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a youth of twenty</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
viceni: <entryFree id="n50830" type="main" key="vi_ce_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcēni</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgēni</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 30, 2</bibl>), ae, a, <sense id="n50830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distrib. adj.</hi> [viginti], <hi rend="ital">twenty each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twenty</hi> distributively. </sense><sense id="n50830.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si duae res quae conferuntur, vicenas habent partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 5</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">annos nonnulli vicenos in disciplinā permanent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militibus denarios quinos vicenos diviserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 7</bibl>; <cb n="VICI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 49, 50, § 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:205" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 51, 77, § 205</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> vicenūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicenūm quinūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 29" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:47" default="NO">47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 7</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50830.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">twenty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diebus vicenis interpositis,</quote> <trans><tr>an interval of twenty days</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 49, § 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:26:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 26, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vicennalis: <entryFree id="n50831" type="main" key="vi_cenna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcennālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vicennium</etym>, <sense id="n50831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of twenty years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every twenty years</hi> (postclass.). </sense><sense id="n50831.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: votis vicennalibus, Num. Alex. Sev. ap. Eckhel. D. N. V. 7, p. 275.— </sense><sense id="n50831.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcennālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a festival on the twentieth anniversary of an emperor's reign</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vicennium: <entryFree id="n50832" type="main" key="vi_cenni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcennĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vicies-annus</etym>, <sense id="n50832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a period of twenty years</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">post decennii aut vicennii tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:8:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vicequaestor: <entryFree id="n50833" type="main" key="vi^ce^quaestor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭcĕquaestor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vicis - quaestor</etym>, = proquaestor (late Lat.), Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Verr. 1:38" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Verr. 1, 38</bibl>.</entryFree>
vicequaestura: <entryFree id="n50834" type="main" key="vi^ce^quaestu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭcĕquaestūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vicis-quaestura</etym>, = proquaestura (late Lat.), Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Arg. ad Cic. Verr. 2" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Arg. ad Cic. Verr. 2</bibl>. 2, 3.</entryFree>
vices: <entryFree id="n50835" type="main" key="vi^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭces</orth>, v. vicis.</entryFree>
vicesima: <entryFree id="n50836" type="main" key="vi_ce_si^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcēsĭma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. vicesimus, II.</entryFree>
vicesimani: <entryFree id="n50837" type="main" key="vi_ce_si^ma_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcēsĭmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vicesimus</etym>, <sense id="n50837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soldiers of the twentieth legion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexillarii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vicesimarius: <entryFree id="n50838" type="main" key="vi_ce_si^ma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcēsĭmārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the twentieth part.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50838.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: aurum, <hi rend="ital">of the tax called</hi> vicesima (v. h. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 10, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50838.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcēsĭmā-rĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a receiver of the</hi> vicesima, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vicesimatio: <entryFree id="n50839" type="main" key="vi_ce_si^ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcēsĭmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing by lot of every twentieth man for execution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicesimation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Macrin. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vicesimus: <entryFree id="n50840" type="main" key="vi_ce_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcēsĭmus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcensĭmus</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīgēsĭmus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 47, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 462 al.</bibl>; but not in Cic.), a, um, <sense id="n50840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ord. num. adj.</hi> [viginti], <hi rend="ital">the twentieth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50840.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra annum vicesimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum jam tertium et vicesimum regnat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censores vicesimi sexti a primis censoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 47, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras mihi Cornificius altero vicesimo die reddidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acastus cum litteris praesto fuit uno et vicesimo die,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicesimo die lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicesima luna sacrificant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexto et vicesimo anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50840.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcēnsĭ-ma</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-suma</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (i. e. pars), <hi rend="ital">the twentieth part</hi>, as a tax; so <hi rend="ital">the twentieth part</hi> or <hi rend="ital">five per cent. of the crop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 2, 12</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; <hi rend="ital">of the value</hi> of a slave that was manumitted, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">71</bibl>.—Called also VICESIMA LIBERTATIS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3131</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3338</bibl>.—As exportduty: <cit><quote lang="la">portorii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:75:section=185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 75, § 185</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">As a tax on inheritances,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vicetia: <entryFree id="n50841" type="main" key="Vi_ce_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vīcētĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Vīcentĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Gallia Transpadana, <hi rend="ital">in the territory of Venetia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Vicenza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 132</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Its inhabitants</hi> are called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vīcētīni</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vīcentīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(VEICETINI),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">VICENTIN,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5972</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vicia: <entryFree id="n50842" type="main" key="vi^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vetch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:29" default="NO">2, 10, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 15, 37, § 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:267" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 267</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vicialia: <entryFree id="n50843" type="hapax" key="vi^ci^a_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭcĭālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vicia</etym>, <sense id="n50843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the stalks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">haulm of vetches</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 30, 5</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
viciarius: <entryFree id="n50844" type="hapax" key="vi^ci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to vetches</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cribrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
viciens: <entryFree id="n50845" type="main" key="vi_ci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcĭens</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcĭes</orth>, <sense id="n50845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adv.</hi> [viginti], <hi rend="ital">twenty times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viciens centena milia passuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viciens tantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superficiem aedium aestimarunt HS. viciens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>two millions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">HS. bis et viciens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non plenum modo viciens habebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:100:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 100, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vicilinus: <entryFree id="n50846" type="hapax" key="Vi^ci^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĭcĭlīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vigil</etym>, <sense id="n50846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Watchful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Vigilant</hi>, an epithet of Jupiter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 44, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vicinalis: <entryFree id="n50847" type="main" key="vi_ci_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vicinus</etym>, <sense id="n50847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neighboring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 26, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <trans><tr>a road over the fields used in common</tr>, <tr>a village-path</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:8:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:7:3" default="NO">43, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 126" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:24:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 24, 9</bibl>. <pb n="1986" /> <cb n="VICI" /></sense></entryFree>
vicinarius: <entryFree id="n50848" type="main" key="vi_ci_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vicinus</etym>, <sense id="n50848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neighboring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi> (post-class.): via, <hi rend="ital">a by-way</hi> in a camp, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Grom. p. 5:2" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Grom. p. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:12:2" default="NO">12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vicine: <entryFree id="n50849" type="main" key="vi_ci_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcīnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vicinus <sense id="n50849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vicinia: <entryFree id="n50850" type="main" key="vi_ci_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcīnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vicinus</etym>, <sense id="n50850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neighborhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nearness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicinage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicinity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50850.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">but cf. vicinitas): proximae viciniae habitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic proximae viciniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier quaedam commigravit huc viciniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic viciniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: inde in viciniā nostra Averni lacus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in viciniā urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetratae vicinia Persidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons elatus super nubila atque in viciniam lunaris circuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <trans><tr>proximity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 93</bibl></cit>: mortem in viciniā videre, Sen. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50850.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">neighborhood</hi>, i. q. <hi rend="ital">neighbors</hi> (freq. but not ante-Aug.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vicinitas): libertina, non ignota viciniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus Egregie factum laudet vicinia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 688</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 636</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 689</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:46" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 4</bibl>; Vall. Max. 5, 7, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 190, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:154" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 154</bibl>.—With a <hi rend="ital">plur. noun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:657" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 657</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 189</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50850.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">near likeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resemblance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similarity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affinity</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">a favorite trope of Quint.): aqua ad viciniam lactis accedens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 22, § 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:123" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 9, 40, § 123</bibl> (al. ad vicina): <cit><quote lang="la">est tamen quamquam diversarum rerum quaedam vicinia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam vicinia virtutum vitiorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est huic tropo quaedam cum synecdoche vicinia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:65" default="NO">9, 3, 65</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
vicinitas: <entryFree id="n50851" type="main" key="vi_ci_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcīnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neighborhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nearness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proximity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicinity</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n50851.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel virtus tua me vel vicinitas Facit, ut te audacter moneam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter vicinitatem totos dies simul eramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire hoc propter vicinitatem facile possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 8, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum et vicinitas propinqua et multitudo esset infinita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:7" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae, consuetudines, vicinitates, clientelae, ludi denique ... quid haberent voluptatis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. Quir. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. B. 2. infra.—</sense><sense id="n50851.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr. </sense><sense id="n50851.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The neighborhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicinity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">region</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Umbriā atque in eā vicinitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50851.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neighborhood</hi>, i. q. <hi rend="ital">neighbors</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si te libenter vicinitas videbit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum, quod erat notum vicinitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44:section=96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44, § 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritas serpit foras cognationibus primum, tum affinitatibus, deinde amicitiis, post vicinitatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 36, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 41</bibl>.— Cf. <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">conveniet autem cum in dando munificum esse, tum in exigendo non acerbum, in omnique re contrahendā ... vicinitatibus et confiniis aequum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50851.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">near likeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resemblance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similarity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">congeniality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affinity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est quaedam inter epichirema et syllogismum vicinitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutibus ac vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusantur vitia vicinitate vitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis (cyperi et cypiri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 69, § 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vicinitus: <entryFree id="n50852" type="hapax" key="vi_ci_ni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcīnĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the neighborhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close by</hi>: omnes intra centum vicinitus arceantur, Cod. Th. 15, 1, 4.</sense></entryFree>
vicinor: <entryFree id="n50853" type="main" key="vi_ci_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcīnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be neighboring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinantia capiti loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:6:27" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 6, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:16:97" default="NO">2, 16, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:34:181" default="NO">2, 34, 181</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaustrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Cap 6:section=608" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Cap 6, § 608</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vicinus: <entryFree id="n50854" type="main" key="vi_ci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vicus</etym>, <sense id="n50854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neighboring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the neighborhood</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vicinity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50854.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50854.2" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contiguus, finitimus): taberna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 29, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 510</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes astris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 759</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo Olympum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:131" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu quam vicina est ultima terra mihi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurgia,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>of neighbors</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 171</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora vicina perusti aetheris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 432</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni convexa foret (terra), parti vicinior esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:275" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 275</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50854.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50854.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a neighbor</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word): <cit><quote lang="la">Eutychus Tuus ... vicinus proximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">proximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10</bibl></cit>, <cb n="VICI" /> 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteri finitimi ac vicini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 20, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel tribules vel vicinos meos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te interioribus vicinis tuis anteponis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus sane vicinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicine Palaemon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50854.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of time, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary</hi>: Tertullianus vicinus eorum temporum, Hier. Script. Eccl. Luc.—</sense><sense id="n50854.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a neighbor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego huc transeo in proximum ad meam vicinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 24</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fides in Capitolio vicina Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus vicina loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:399" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 399</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50854.7" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a neighboring place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the neighborhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicinity</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">stellae in vicino terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 16, 13, § 68</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in vicino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 15:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex (e) vicino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 75, § 145</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis rigans vicina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 18, 22, § 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 573</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Syriae vicina pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 32, 59, § 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50854.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">nearly resembling in quality</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allied</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dialecticorum scientia vicina et finitima eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 32, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicina praedictae, sed amplior virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his rebus, quibus nomina sua sunt, vicinis potius uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicina virtutibus vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: quod est <foreign lang="greek">u(poptw/sei</foreign> vicinum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor croco vicinus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 29, § 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 18, 69, § 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui vicinum est, non negare quod obicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 81</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum molle plumboque vicinius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50854.9" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ex eodem sed ex diverso vicinum accipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum ab amethysto distat hyacinthos, tamen e vicino descendens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 41, § 125</bibl></cit> (al. ab vicino tamen colore descendens).—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vīcīnē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the neighborhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near by</hi> (late Lat.): (fluvius) quantum crescit aquis, pisces vicinius offert, <hi rend="ital">nearer by</hi>, Ven. Carm. 3, 12, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinissime frui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 1:33" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 1, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
vicis: <entryFree id="n50855" type="main" key="vi^cis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĭcis</orth> (as a <sense id="n50855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.;</hi> the <case>nom.</case> does not occur), vicem, vice; in <number>plur.</number>, vices (<case>nom.</case> and <case>acc.</case>) and vicibus (<case>dat.</case> and <case>abl.</case>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei)/kw</foreign>, to yield; root <foreign lang="greek">vik-</foreign>; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 135" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 135</bibl></etym>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interchange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alternation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alternate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reciprocal succession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicissitude</hi> (the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> not ante-Aug.; the other cases class.). </sense><sense id="n50855.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50855.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; for which, in class. prose, vicissitudo). </sense><sense id="n50855.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: ignotus juvenum coetus alternā vice Inibat alacris, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 214</bibl> P. (Trag. v. 151 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">hac vice sermonum,</quote> <trans><tr>conversation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 535</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vice sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:79" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 79</bibl></cit>; cf. in the foll. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus haec fortasse benigna Reducet in sedem vice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:8" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvitur acris hiems grata vice veris et Favoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoti Patres vice fortunarum humanarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31, 6</bibl></cit>: dum Nox vicem peragit, <hi rend="ital">performs the exchange</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">alternales with day</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 218</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridica contingens vitem mutuā vice sustinetur et sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versā vice,</quote> <trans><tr>reversely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:29:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 29, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. p. 32, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. p. 363</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:5:11 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 5, 11 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n50855.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerumque gratae divitibus vices Mundaeque parvo sub Lare pauperum Cenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et interrogandi se ipsum et respondendi sibi solent esse non ingratae vices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:10:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 10, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius lectionis taedium vicibus levatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet has vices condicio mortalium, ut adversa ex secundis, ex adversis secunda nascantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium diei noctis excipiunt vices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec quoque non perstant ... Quasque vices peragant ... docebo,</quote> <trans><tr>what vicissitudes they undergo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutat terra vices,</quote> <trans><tr>renews her changes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perque vicis modo Persephone! modo Filia! clamat,</quote> <trans><tr>alternately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:483" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 483</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">per vicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per vices annorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>every other year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 14, 30, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur vicibus factis convivia ineant,</quote> <trans><tr>alternately</tr>, <tr>by turns</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:353" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 353</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50855.5" n="2" level="3"> Adverb.: in vicem (also freq. one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">invĭcem</orth>; and less freq. vicem, in vices, or per vices), <hi rend="ital">by turns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alternately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one after the other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reciprocally.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50855.6" n="a" level="4"> In vicem: bibenda aqua: postero die etiam vinum: deinde in vicem alternis diebus modo <cb n="VICI" /> aqua modo vinum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqui, qui domi manserunt, se atque alios alunt: hi rursus in vicem anno post in armis sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter vicinitatem simul eramus invicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:168" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 168</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis invicem casibus victi victoresque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 44, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non comisantium in vicem more jam diu vivimus inter nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 9, 8</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in vicem inter se gratantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 43, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque vicem tua me, te mea forma capit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 180</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 631</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 473</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 188</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:141 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 141 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50855.7" n="b" level="4"> Vicem: <cit><quote lang="la">ut unus fasces haberet, et hoc insigne regium suam cujusque vicem, per omnes iret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 36, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50855.8" n="c" level="4"> In vices (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">inque vices illum tectos qui laesit amores, Laedit amore pari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 26</bibl> Halm.—</sense><sense id="n50855.9" n="d" level="4"> Per vices (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quod ipsum imperari per vices optimum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit> Halm.—</sense><sense id="n50855.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50855.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn</hi> (late Lat.; cf. Orell. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 13</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ager tertiā vice arabitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus per diem vicibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tesserulas in medium vice suā quisque jaciebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:13:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vice quādam,</quote> <trans><tr>once</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Pan. Grat. Aug. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50855.12" n="2" level="3"> Reciprocal behavior or conduct, i. e. <hi rend="ital">return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">requital</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reciprocal service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recompense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remuneration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retaliation</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">recito praedicationem amplissimi beneficii, vicem officii praesentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto proclivius est injuriae quam beneficio vicem exsolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:13:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 13, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">redde vicem meritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non poteris ipsa referre vicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 370</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dejecit acer plus vice simplici (i. e. non tantam solum cladem illis intulit quantam ipsi dederant, sed duplum, Schol.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 13</bibl></cit> Orell. ad loc.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spernentem sperne, sequenti Redde vices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque est ullus affectus ... qui magis vices exigat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:85:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 85, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50855.13" n="3" level="3"> The changes of fate, <hi rend="ital">fate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misfortune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi uni necesse erit et meam et aliorum vicem pertimescere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignando et ipse vicem ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacite gementes tristem fortunae vicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vicem suam conquestus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convertere humanam vicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:88" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicā vice commoveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 33</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fors et Debita jura vicesque superbae Te maneant ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testor in occasu vestro nec tela nec ullas Vitavisse vices Danaūm,</quote> <trans><tr>dangers</tr>, <tr>contests</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 433</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50855.14" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the position</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duty</hi> of one person or thing as assumed by another (the usual signif. of the word): <cit><quote lang="la">heredum causa justissima est: nulla est enim persona, quae ad vicem ejus, qui e vitā emigrarit, propius accedat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:19:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 19, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego succedens in vicem imperii tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:48:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 48, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse in locum vicemque consulis provolat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam (Juppiter) te dedit, qui erga omne humanum genus vice suā fungereris,</quote> <trans><tr>stand in the place of</tr>, <tr>represent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:80:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 80, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fungar vice cotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A.
