P. 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per speciem alienae fungendae vicis opes suas firmavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 41, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sacra regiae vicis desererentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestramque meamque vicem explete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus ... ego vicem debeo inplere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Manus) adverbiorum atque pronominum obtinent vicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ordine vicis suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: non ad suum pertinere officium rati, quando divisae professionum vices essent, Quint. Inst. prooem. § 4.—</sense><sense id="n50855.15" n="2" level="3"> Adverb. </sense><sense id="n50855.16" n="a" level="4"> Vicem, with the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or a <hi rend="ital">pers. pron.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the place of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instead of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the sake of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eri vicem meamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui hodie sese excruciari meam vicem possit pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos respondetote istinc istarum vicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuam vicem saepe doleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam vicem indignantem magistratu abisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 31, 11</bibl></cit>: remittimus hoc tibi, ne nostram vicem irascaris. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 32, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicito consuli ... eorum vicem quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex, vicem eorum quos ad tam manifestum periculum miserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maestus non suam vicem, sed propter, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: cum Pompeius aedem Victoriae dedicaturus foret, cujus gradus vicem theatri essent, Tiro Tull. ap. <pb n="1987" /> <cb n="VICT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam res familiaris obsidis vicem esse apud rempublicam videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50855.17" n="(b)" level="5"> Sometimes in a more general sense, <hi rend="ital">after the manner of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sardanapali vicem in suo lectulo mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: ceteri vicem pecorum obtruncabantur, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 497, 26</bibl>; cf. the foll.—</sense><sense id="n50855.18" n="b" level="4"> Vice, <hi rend="ital">instead of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pane salis vice utuntur nitro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temonis vice trahitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murum urbi cocto latere circumdedit, harenae vice bitumine interstrato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exanimes vice unius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus vice populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50855.19" n="(b)" level="5"> In a more general sense (cf. the preced. numbers), <hi rend="ital">after the manner of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactari se passa fluctu algae vice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 45, 68, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moveri periclitantium vice possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diebus ac noctibus vice mundi circumagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeque dixerat, oracli vice accipiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut deorum vice mortuos honorarent,</quote> <trans><tr>like gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vice navium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 47, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vice pecudum occidi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vice imbellium proculcati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 3, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50855.20" n="c" level="4"> In vicem, <hi rend="ital">instead of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in place of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potest malleolus protinus in vicem viviradicis conseri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:14:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defatigatis in vicem integri succedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnium vicem regni unius insatiabilis amor Successit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missis in vicem eorum quinque milibus sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 1</bibl>; so <case>dat.</case> vici, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 6:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 6, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50855.21" n="d" level="4"> Ad vicem, <hi rend="ital">instead of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tegularum et imbricum vicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 44, § 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vicem solis cinis calidus subjectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 28</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">very rarely, ad invicem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n50855.22" n="(b)" level="5"> In a more general sense (cf. in the preced. numbers a. and b.), <hi rend="ital">after the manner of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores natu a majoribus colebantur ad deum prope ad parentum vicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
